Why would I need to connect to the online server just to play the game? Not only won't it connect, its saying the server is having an issue and making me jump through hoops. To me this means trouble as I NEVER play online, too many hackers, and without the online connection, all of a sudden I can't even play a solo game in the game which I PURCHASED! EA has become the ultimate dealer of underhanded and foul business practices and I for one am sick of it. I will never purchase a product from them again. So what if they no longer support the version, which is what I am guessing happened, I should STILL be able to play my dang game in solo mode, and I cannot. 

P.S. I checked the server status and the Steam server is online and running...
good

I'm not a everyday player, but game is useless once 2K Sports shut down the servers.  You own a game that you can't play.  I don't play online, and I don't need to buy the "new" NBA game every year, when the only thing that changes is the roster.  Basketball is basketball.  I haven't played this game in over a year, but tonight I wanted to play basketball, and can't continue my OFFLINE career because the game needs internet to play offline.  I miss when you actually owned a game and could just pop it in and play the game, no matter how much time passed, because you actually owned a game.

This game is pure S _ _ T.

Don't buy this game, even if you love basketball or this is on sale. It's just a HUGE waste of money.
like
i havent played this game in a long time so idk how to rate it

[h1] Plus : [/h1] 

- The only reason I bought this game was that I did not own any NBA2K games prior and I desperately wanted to play test it, luckily only for 30$, anything more than that, I'll better off selling my PC and buying a PS5 or XBOX
- Realism, motion capture on A+
- Controller- Friendly.
- Plain, mediocre but non offensive story plot line .


[h1] Minus : [/h1] 

- Go and browse through other reviews and you'll know why it's 'not recommended' 
- Micro-transactions, the online feature of this game relies HEAVILY on micro-transactions from skins to skills upgrade
- Hackers, since there's no sort of VAC related stuff going on, you'll probably gonna see a game that's out for 2 weeks but you'll encounter a 99 overall 5'10 Chinese Lebron James full with swappable skins while riding in a scooter
- MyTeam AKA FUT Team in FIFA, another fast cash-milking machine developed by NBA2K, essentially what it does is you'll need high-rated players to against other high-rated players. I'll dumb it down by saying it's like a Pokemon Trading Card Game where you'll just need a Charizard VS another player who has Blasttoise. 
- Game mechanics not as polished as FIFA, play FIFA then you'll know player movements/ reactions / timings
- Feeling shot timing inconsistency when you're playing the online feature ? Well, good news, it's a regional based server thing, it's the problem with NBA2K servers. Managed to test it out by playing with friends from other regions and they all said the same thing, it's the thing with NBA2K servers and they felt the shot timing was off as well, not responsive and as through there were some minor ping issues
- NBA2K servers is just a literal, utter, disgusting garbage, most of the time you'll find yourself getting kicked out by the server because the server is experiencing some issues
- The other game modes like ProAM, BlackTop, MyGM is just worthless imo, there's no 'signature' mode other than the ones I've listed above
- AI difficulty is just as bad as FIFA's. Tune it way up causes AI slider to significantly overpower you, 99 overall 3 point shooting Stephen Curry won't see you splash in 99 percent of the time, on the other end, tune it slightly down will see you using a 5'10 Chinese Lebron James just using Sprint button and dunking across 5 defenders. In conclusion, NBA2K failed to establish a comfortable middle ground AI behaviour for a casual + competitive environment
- Grinding: The 300+ hours you see on my account ? I should proudly say I spend 80% of the time grinding in the Park, play a online 3 v 3, do some passing, dunking, 3 pointers, rise and repeat that about a 1000 times, then you finally get to upgrade some skill points. Essentially, a Pay to Win game, more skill points -> better your character. This game relies MINIMALLY on skills and at the end of the day, you'll find yourself getting beaten by a 12 year old just cause their parents have more money than yours
- As this is the PC version of NBA2K21, you could literally spend the same or even less amount of money on the 'next-gen' version of NBA2K21 on consoles which have better texture, upgraded visuals and mechanics


[h1] What's fun : [/h1] 

- Dunking, 3 pointer, dribbling which you could do in real life but instead you chose to sit down in your parent's basement to press some buttons
- Splashing you money to NBA2K so that they can CTRL+C, CTRL+V their codings and designs for the next NBA2K


[h1] CPU / GPU Specs : [/h1] 

- Intel® Core™ i9-9900 Processor
- Asus ROG Strix GeForce RTX 2060 SUPER



[h1] Buy/ Not Buy ? : [/h1] 

- Buy it on sale and please avoid the full price, as I have detailed, this game is just a cut and paste since NBA2K18, with some minor graphical changes

I am a big fan of basketball. I bought two 2k games (this one and 2k20) and it just isn't worth the price. The amount of pay to win and glitch animations just make the game not fun. I wish they would make one 2K and then release dlc on a regular basis with constant updates to players and leagues. But with how much they make right now there is zero incentive to change anything. I don't think any of the 2k games really meet the value of what they are charging. Additionally they shut down their servers so quickly. They make EA look good considering FIFA 18 is still up and running on servers (it will shut down in November of 2023). 

This is just my opinion, but if you are considering buying a 2k game I would recommend not to.

I have bought every single NBA 2K game since 2k11, and before that, I played every single NBA Live game. Each year, 2K gets terrible reviews and gets ripped apart for their launch day glitches and bugs, but I've always known they'll get fixed. I play myLEAGUE, myCAREER, and myTEAM a ton. This years' game has everything it needs to be great. But the shooting. The shooting in this game is so unexplainably terrible, the game isn't worth buying at all. If the 2K team releases a patch for the shooting, it'll change everything. I've put almost 16 hours of gameplay in over this release weekend, and for an example of the terrible shooting mechanics, I'll say this: In a practice (no defense whatsoever), I shot 2/25 on wide open mid-range jumpers with KOBE BRYANT, one of the greatest scorers in NBA history. You could say "get gud" or that I', garbage, but I've literally been playing 2k and other NBA games my entire life. The mechanics for getting a "green" are broken. In an attempt to create a more "realistic" experience for scoring, 2K has created the most unrealistic shooting game in the history of basketball games. NBA Jam is better. I give this game 0/10 stars, and if you're considering buying it, wise up.

My last NBA 2K game period. It is awful in every way. None of the AI teammate problems from previous years have been fixed. MyCareer is 90% scripted garbage in the beginning. You can't change camera or length of halves....so you get 10 minute halves for a college game. Your player sucks out of the gate so he isn't going to hit anything. The shooting mechanic sucks so bad I can't believe it was left in for release. The shot meter is barely visible on a PC monitor and button shooting has all but been completely broken in the game if not impossible. Microtransactions are everywhere in the game and its obvious they make you suck horribly just so you will get frustrated and buy coins to level up your player.

Some other studio needs to compete with 2K in basketball and quick. This has gotten completely out of hand. Your player also moves like he is stuck in molasses and can't change directions easily at all. It is so clunky. Teammates are still dumb as rocks and hold the ball forever, don't box out, don't guard, don't switch on D correctly and the game still randomly switches you on D to someone you have no chance of guarding for no apparent reason. The draft combine sucks and is the worst 20 minutes of mini games you will ever put yourself through. The story in MyCareer is beyond annoying, trite and ridiculously scripted against you. I have no idea what anyone was thinking putting this nonsense into a basketball game. Perhaps 2K should make a visual novel since that seems to be what they are going for here. Meanwhile we just want to play basketball and not have microtransactions shoved in our face constantly or telling us we are mediocre when we have good games....just so we will level our player up by buying stupid coins.

2K has lost it. Completely lost it. This game is a pile of trash. I got it on sale and I still feel ripped off.This is the worst 2K basketball I've ever played. It is so bad. People are not exaggerating when they say it is bad.

MyCareer also only works online and this is unnecessary. It is done so that players who enjoy this mode will be forced to buy the latest 2K NBA but it is a very unethical practice. So you are renting the game for 59.99 for 2 years if all you play is offline. This should be illegal but it is not b/c some of the game works. But no more for me. This is it. I'm not renting a game for 2 years and I own far too many other games for one to be disabled in that short of time.

Easily the WORST entry I've seen. The only good change between this and 2k20 was the new neighbourhood, but it has no personality since they stripped out quite literally EVERY interaction with NPCs outside the intro story. I would've been fine with all that being stripped out, sinc eit was made during covid and released before the 19-20 season had even finished.

But then they released the "next-gen" version that had ALL of that added back in, and a completely different neighbourhood then current gen. Why they won't update the PC version to the newer version, or even sell a "next gen upgrade" for 20 bucks, I'll never know. But knowing there's a complete version of this game somewhere really chaps my behind.

Add on top of that the game breaking bugs, like NO matchmaking for events or the Rec, making it impossible to gain Rep, and this game isn't worth 5 dollars.

What happen to NBA 2K, the last version was back 2012. Every year the quality goes down. The unnecessary changes with the controls and the shot meter doesn't improve anything, it just make the gameplay less fun and engaging, specially for long time offline players. Still have delayed animations even when playing with a very capable PC and even the halftime show has the same animation for a decade now. Shaq and Kenny doesn't even look at the camera, they keep looking the other way and so robotic. The My Player mode is laughable. You would need a lot of mods to fully enjoy this game, specially the half ass classic team roster. Most of the Classic teams only has 6-7 legit players, I actually have to create atleast 2 players on each classic teams so that the rotations be more accurate. I give up on this franchise, don't want to waste my money anymore. Not recommended, it is not worth a single penny.

NBA 2K21 is a game that is very conflicting. On one hand, you have an amazing NBA simulation, the feeling of playing NBA 2K21 is like controlling a TV broadcast. Franchise mode offers tons of customization, you can become your own dynasty in the NBA in this game. MyCareer offers a great NBA simulation of being a player. The games feel realistic, exciting, and most of all fun. However, NBA 2K21 suffers from one massive issue. It doesn't differentiate between itself and NBA 2K20 to be worth purchasing. The franchise mode, while in depth, is just as in depth as NBA 2K20, as it doesn't change anything up enough to at all to be different to the older games. In the games themselves, the gameplay does not differ much from the older releases either. Just as last year, it suffers from a massive problem of microtransactions and shoving them down the players throat. It's not worth the purchase, especially if you own an older NBA 2K game.

NBA 2k21 on PC is just 2k20 with a new roster a new MyPlayer neighbourhood and a few other minor tweaks. Get NBA 2k21.

It is not a next gen experience on PC. For some reason PC users have to wait for an experience their PCs can handle.

MyCareer is different but missing lots of features from 2k20... There's a pre-NBA career with cut scenes and a handful of choices... Then it's back to the early games with just the NBA games and training to do for your character... Most if not all of the cut scenes are gone in their place is a larger neighbourhood... Ok when there was an online playerbase... Not so good now... Just wastes time going from A to B...

They also randomly destroy their user base with updates that corrupt save files, wiping thousands of hours of gameplay by corrupting their save files... All of mine and many others data has been corrupted, from myplayer to myleague they all got corrupted... This wouldn't be as big of an issue if their support was able to respond within 24 hours instead of the 4 days it takes them at best... And then they are completely useless, no idea where Steam stores their files...

The game also has random crashes that have been there since release as well as glitches with their community uploads which causes edits to team uniforms or arenas to not save once due to a connection issue...

There's also a game save bug where you cannot save you games after a certain time. Both MyCareer and MyLeague have been rendered useless in my game... EDIT found a fix for this myself... Regedit and deletion of save game folders...

If you really love basketball get 2k20... Or give 2k a few years to work out what they are doing wrong with the latest gen version before considering upgrading to the latest... If you are really desperate for the latest then expect a lot of bugs in 2k22...

I am going to mention some pros and cons of my experience with this game.
Pros:
	- Latest NBA game developed by 2K at review time with different changes around mods.
	- It is my second NBA game and from then a lot have changed.
	- The career mode is really fun to play with decisions to make etc.
  	-For me, (9 hours of play time at review time), the game crashed only once, and that was on quick play. I played with 60 hz and vsync/dynamic vsync on (it may help) and I also updated the graphics card drivers before starting to play.
	- For me, the shot meter feels realistic so it is not a problem.
Cons:
	- On multiplayer (for example 3vs 3 on MyTeam) there are some issues with the game ( mostly the crowd) - it moves with a little lag and latency issues, but that should be fixed with the next updates if there will be some.
	- When I first got into MyTeam (  around 72 OVR team), I tried to play multiplayer and the opponents the game found for me had around 95 OVR team.
	With these said, the PC version needs some updates to complete the game. I also need to mention that I installed the game on a SSD.
Good

>You get stuck in players, even your own teammates, they are like walls preventing you from moving.
>Getting stuck in players drains your stamina.
>Imbalanced "luck" system, what I mean is most games you can perform really well, and when 2K doesn't want you to win, it's pretty obvious and its annoying.
>Passing direction sucks, you can pass straight to the opponent if you don't understand the mechanic.

Again you have to play to understand just how bad this game really is, and imagine it being the same every year.

Every year it just gets worse. Features missing, gameplay is bad, career mode gets more and more frustrating due to whatever adjustments have been made. Not to mention if you adjust framerate of the game, it causes the game to literally slow motion play out between timeouts, or when your player can simulate the time on the bench. A few weeks later, second patch, again, corrupted the entire game and had to reinstall everything. Surely, it wouldn't happen a third time, but wait, it did. So I uninstalled and left this game in my library. I shouldn't have to reinstall the game every time there's a patch or update. I'm recommending this game because I got it on sale, but I would never pay full price for it. I don't keep up to date with every NBA 2K game. The last one I was playing was 2K18 on the PS3, so I was excited to finally play an updated game with updated features. Unfortunately it's underwhelming. There's a cap on some of your stats depending on what type of player you create which is really annoying. So after they reach a certain point they just don't increase anymore. I'm also finding this game more difficult to play than previous 2K games. The AI seems to be able to easily get past you whenever they want no matter what you do. I also don't know if it's just me or not, but since my player was drafted into the NBA I haven't gotten any kind of cut scenes to continue the story. There isn't even any post game interviews or press conferences. You just play a game and when it's over you go right back to the menu. I don't know if that will change as I progress more but I feel like that takes away from the experience. I'm having fun with it but it is lacking a lot. And from what I can tell from the other reviews, 2K barely changes anything with each game release. Pretty frustrating.

I honestly don't know why I buy the same game each year. It's literally the same, MyCareer, MyTeam, play now, blacktop etc... It's shit. The grind for MyCareer is so boring/grindy and you only make about 500-600 VC each game, and it takes forever to level up the overall of your player. MyTeam is basically pay to win, where the chances of unpacking a good card are so low you won't even get it. At least 2K are generous enough to give us free locker codes... I own this game on PS5 as well, and let me tell you this is the last gen version! It isn't even as updated as the next-gen 2K21 game! Also, the game is BROKEN, there are so many glitches, missed calls by the refs(!) and other shit like that... In conclusion don't waste your money on this trash ... I mean if you are a huge basketball fan like me it's ok when you are bored out of your mind.

Really fun at first with the MyCareer but once you get into the NBA there is no more actual content left. It assumes that most people play MyCareer till they get to the NBA and go play Neighborhood afterwards. Speaking of the Neighborhood, the amount of hackers in the lobbies sickens me. Almost every person who displays a 90+ overall, their card shows a 60 overall, and they tend to green almost every shot they take even with a good amount of coverage. This is very frustrating when you are playing legitimately and you want to level up your Rep. Also, 99 overall cards basically ensures that every player has A / A+ stats on everything, even when those stats don't translate to real life. Take an Invincible Ben Simmons card for example. Ben Simmons is not an A+ 3pt shooter, even though he has improved for the most part. Also, the player AI isn't very realistic, as many players don't play like their real life selves at all. Also, if you are trying to guard someone, they will shift to a different area and as you follow, 99% of the time you will get stuck on a teammate, basically allowing the person a free shot. Honestly wondering if I should even buy 2k22 as it may be the same copy-paste game with the same amount of bugs / hackers with the only addition being more sweat. They barely even change the looks of the actual players. The 2k team better get their heads out of their ass if they want people to keep playing their games, cause this is the worst 2k to date.

Best basketball simulation game currently available, by default. Game play has minor improvements, online game connections usually run smoothly. Yes but... Firstly this review is based solely on the My Career portion of this game. If you already have a recent version of NBA 2K you can definitely pass on this one. There is nothing really new or earth shattering in the current version. In some ways it's something of a step backwards in areas such as the shooting mechanic. The graphics are not much improved either. If you are a big fan of the NBA and or the 2K series and you can get this title on sale at 50% off or more it's probably worth it. Be warned it is a VERY grindy experience and you will need to put in a fair bit of time or spend actual money on VC before you have a player who isn't totally frustrating to watch crawl up and down the court, miss wide open shots and jump barely high enough to touch the rim. Once you have put in the time or money the actual games are enjoyable.

They try real hard to polish this steaming pile of hot dog shit to make it shine.. I've never felt so disrespected while playing a game in my entire life. Truly one of a kind in that respect. There is no competitor for basketball games leaving you two options.. play it or don't.. but be warned buying VC wont make your character better.. you're time gated to playing games and unlocking badges before your specialist can start to compete.

Whether its dunking, shooting or defense.. you can spend 100$+ to create an overall player rating of 90+ and no matter what you choose without badges you will miss your shots, dunks, blocks & the like.. even at 95 3pt shooting wide open unguarded 3's are bricked. Slashing with a 6'9 90+ finisher with no badges means that 6'1 defender will have you fumbling the take & in the most obscene ways possible missing your layup/dunks with no foul. Passing? If you're team is up 10+ points its better to let the AI double team and strip you everytime *which they will* because if you try and pass it out with even a 90+ passer rating you will overthrow 7ft tall centers standing wide open under the hoop. 

Even after pushing through and grinding games for a few badges you will be met with a completely disrespectful AI system that will have your own team stepping into your lanes to slow you down, avoiding your passes & refusing to pass you open looks. Play the game on whatever difficulty setting you want it doesn't change the level of disrespect built into this garbage dump. It really does look great from the outside looking in, especially when there is no other option for games like this.. but the reviews are no joke this game is awful on an entirely new level.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

After putting in some more time I wanted to give an update.
I'm currently playing a 98 overall Shooting Guard for the Knicks, we are in our second season coming off of a championship last season. Our current lineup after losing Derrick Rose & a few others to the offseason is..

Point Guard - Me (98), Shooting Guard - RJ Barrett (84), Small Forward - Julius Randle (89), Power Forward - John Collins (84), Center - Mitchell Robinson (83), Bench Players: Nerlens Noel PF/C (80), Obi Toppin PF/SF (80), Immanuel Quickley SG/PG (80), Frank Ntilikina PG/SG (80), Blake Griffin PF/C (78).. 

We are currently 13-2 in our second season & I have managed to average a triple double over these 15 games with a stat line of 34 pts, 12 rebounds, 12 assists, 1 steal, 1 block, Shooting % is around 60 with 3pt also around 60%. I take around 20 shots a game.

I play on Hall of Fame difficulty & have noticed a trend starting after my first few wins. Nobody makes a shot on my team anymore. My starters & bench for the last game vs the Heat shot 23 times making a grand total of 3. T H R E E makes in TWENTY THREE shots. These are half time numbers because I rage quit before the game was over. Now in these three shots I had to get all three assists and STRUGGLED to make them happen. I personally had 24 pts with 85% shooting percentage.. we as a team had just over 30% shooting at the half.. I don't understand how much more difficult the game can get as I am single handled responsible for all of the defensive stops, rebounds & offensive production points, assists & offensive rebounds I am playing 9v1 with a team that has a Team Chemistry rating of 99%. I don't have fun at all playing anymore.. sometimes I would get a game here and there that gave me a somewhat good feeling afterwords .. not anymore. The only reason i've continued to play is my OCD itching me to reach 99 overall. I hope to reach it soon and walk away from the NBA2K franchise for good.

Let's talk 2k. 
I've been playing 2k since 2k11. I love the series, and there are no basketball sims out there to give it any form of competition. I saw this game on sale for like less than 10 dollars and had to give it a go. My review is solely based on a (PC) Association/Rebuilders perspective.

The Bad and Ugly.
AI is still incredibly exploitable in game and out of game. The simulation aspect is wonky and doesnt really work. The menus are complex with all these options that dont really mean anything sometimes. Shot tendencies have to be manually change to make people primary scorers even if you set them as the primary scorer. The coaching and plays system really doesnt work and i cant wrap my head around how to make things work. The rebuilding aspect is still fun however i have some more complaints about in game stuff:

1.Creating a draft class has absolutely pitiful design options. There are so few options, autogenerated people feel the same after two classes. No hairs, no hair options, no hair colors, no design freedom. A huge stepback in creating draft classes. It seems all the design options are locked behind myplayer park stuff now.

2.Players doing fuck all in game. Centers and powerforwards will just sit in place and not move. whether its on the 3 line, on the baseline, or anywhere really. The game literally breaks. players wont set baseline screens themselves, or attempt to get shooters open. They all just stand there. When you manually call screen either the guy wont move then immediately roll to the basket, or he will screen, the D will instantly switch and you are denied. But sometimes the pick and roll works and the AI does absolutely nothing to defend against the center or pf and just allows free buckets. This is really boring.

3. Greenlighting. I hate this mechanic when trying to control 10 people on the floor. If you get slightly early or late at the 3 line you have about a 20 percent chance of making 3s. Midrange is even worse bricking wide open shots. The game wants you to use hotzones, badges, and greenlighting to make shots but memorizing 10 peoples shots, their zones, timings just isnt reasonable. Like why is it so difficult to make wide open shots. Meanwhile the AI just chucks bad shots up and they go in. The paint is so broken because people driving to the basket just get insane bonuses and if aren't directly blocked have almost a 80 percent chance of making the shot. SO if you want to effectively score just drive to the basket. It doesnt help that Ai GLUES to you on the 3 line then breaks down into tears when you drive to the basket.

Other than that the mycareer sucks. I hate how your character is limited to certain builds. I think they should split the career and park in my humble opinion. But that wouldnt work well for them paygating progress. The card casino game-mode is cheeks and always will be. All in all it feels like 2k continues to regress and give less options to people as time goes on. The game runs slow, crashes, doesnt load in things, and the netcode was good in 2009. Shit game but there are no alternatives.

But hey at least we got the WNBA in game, and when loading into match i get useless videos playing through 2ktv to further slow my loading times and slow the game down :)

I've been an avid NBA fan since I could fathom the idea of basketball. When I was a child, I had picked up 2K8 and played it on the PS3, it was my first 2K game and I was instantly a fan of the series. Years have gone by, various 2k titles have come and gone, some better than others... some worse, but then there was 2k21. 2k21, was supposed to be 'the next big thing'. 'Redefined from the ground up with the power of next gen consoles', yet the next gen edition isn't even available to those who have devices twofold the power of these new consoles? 

Every single year, it's the same game, over and over again, empty promises, and very very small changes to the MyCareer, and gamemode selection, i.e narrative, roster/depth chart changes, and character nicknames. The same commentary dialogue has been used for a decade, the same sloppy animations have been used for half a decade, they even took out the Halftime Show when they moved from 20 to 21. I thought we were supposed to add assets from one title to the next, not remove them? 

I want to like this game, I want to like this series, I want to so bad, because they're the only people that can make it. They have the funding and licenses, and they know people will pick up their POS copy-and-paste title year after year, because we have no choice. 

2k21 is a redundancy; another iteration in the bleak year-by-year cycle. It's a slap in the face to any real basketball fan. It's genuinely a waste of time to purchase this on a PC for anything less than an on-sale price, and that's being generous. At this point, go back. Play older titles that you know will bring you joy. There is no sign of a fix for this franchise coming in the near future, and it's apparent they do not care for the PC community. 

Sigh.

I seriously like this year nba2k. really. I think in terms of gameplay, the physicality, movement and the dribble moves have improved a lot. More realism. But are this improvement have you fork out cash to buy a 2k20?

And thats all the pros. 

Here are the cons:
-Shot aiming, the dev guy who came up with it - ought to be shot. 
-This is basically a 2k20. Just roster updates, No, not roster updates - they basically added new players via player creation. Everything in the roster remained the same. They didnt even bother updating the profile picture. 
- Oh yeah, the same ol same ol. same interface, roster face, same my league, same like last year and the year before and before. 
-This is what prompt me to leave a review: CPU played horrendous transition defence. I have my PG grabbing the defensive rebound - CPU instead backing down to defend leave their man and start double teaming me. A flick on the pass button I immediately turn this into a 4 vs 2 fastbreak. This is horrendous CPU defensive logic. No amount of sliders can fix this. It rendered the game unplayable. 
 
I'm no longer surprise 2K dont bother even come up with a patch to fix this. 2K just wants to grab your money and go. Thankfully I only grab this during a steam holiday discount.

It's hard to believe that 2K has managed to make this game obtuse in every department imaginable, but lo and behold they've managed.

Net play- Garbage connectivity, no cheat detection. You've won a jackpot if you manage to find a stable, fair net matchup and yet they've made it a requirement for unlocking animations or accessories for your character.

MyTeam- Speaking of jackpots, new and improved MyTeam gambling complete with 0 ownership of your players. That's right, they have limited use now and get your wallet ready if you want to maintain the good ones you've picked up.

MyCareer- This is the one I'm most disappointed in, as bad as everything else is. Literal selling point for this series for so long, you'd think 2K would want to hold onto its longevity. Big whopping NOPE. Between gridlock online DRM causing crashes/disconnects/unplayability, to trying to play with anything over 60 FPS causing gameplay issues and crashes, and even a complete gut of any attempt to customize your character now being limited to unbearable online play. And they call this release next-gen? We had 4K 60 FPS a decade ago, this is a JOKE.

I knew to wait for a sale to pick this up with every negative said about it, but I don't even feel like I'm getting my money's worth picking this up for $15 because the game is just incomplete from there in an attempt to push you into microtransactions just to be able to level up your character...awful. Last 2K I will ever buy.

I played NBA 2K13 years ago and picked this game up because it was on sale. As far as the gameplay its pretty fun and I like what they added with the badges for your player. The gameplay is challenging but rewarding when you get to your spots and make shots.

However there is a very gamebreaking issue I run into REGULARLY. In order to upgrade your players stats you accumulate VC and you get VC after completing games, or so I thought. I'll play a game or 2 before checking my VC balance only to find out I didn't get any VC for the previous games I have played. I have probably missed out on 15,000 VC by now and it is so frustrating. It seems like this is a bug that has been in the game SINCE RELEASE, yet 2K hasnt fixed it at all. Not sure if its a business strategy to get players to purchase VC or just gross negligence by 2K, but its embarassing a large company like 2K has such a glaring issue with their game. I have played 29 hours in the last week and I have decided to uninstall the game because it is too frustating to deal with. Save yourself the money until 2K shows they care about their playerbase because right now it seems like they know people will buy their game regardless of the quality. I will give NBA2K22 a chance because I like the gameplay, but if its dogshit like this one is, 2K will have lost another customer

I love 2k games. I've been playing them since 2k12. It is absolutely INSANE that a multi-billion dollar company can make a game this awful. Here's a list of problems:

Problem 1. Animations
There have always been a select few animations that everybody used to look better or play better. Apparently, the perfectly okay animations weren't good enough for EA, because all of the good ones have been changed. They look extremely different and confused me when I first started playing the game and it screwed up all of my animations that I used to use

Problem 2. Shot timing
If you were good at the old shooting, boy are you in luck, not. The shot timing in this game is awful. It's basically impossible to make a shot with any defense on you. You can make the perfect shot and have the bar in the red spot and still miss it. They added a "50% chance to score" to make it more realistic. I don't think there are any shot guards in the entire NBA, hell, the WORLD with a 50% score rate.

As usual for ALL 2K games, specifically on PC, it is just the same game recycled over and over, but advertised as new. This is the case for 2K21.

The game is subpar, and has a lot of issues within MyLeague, including like the last few years, randomly deleting or corrupting saves that contain various custom teams/content immediately after their first save & exit, and also a STRONG resistance to ever keeping your custom alternate jerseys for custom made expansion teams. Unlike the last couple of years though, 2K21 actually straight up refuses to allow custom jerseys at all half the time for custom expansion teams. It just straight up denies it and tells you no. It's f**ked. Other annoying things like half the time it won't even be willing to load in custom teams from the servers either. The list goes on.

And something that has been present through all iterations of NBA 2K is the random cheese where you clearly block a shot or steal a pass, but the game casually says "nope" and phases the ball and even the hands and arms of the players you're defending THROUGH you, giving itself baskets, generally screwing you over.

Also a huge negative for me is that they pulled the extra customization options on create a player after 2K15. That customization was FIRE. I loved it and thrived on it. I lived on that for creating all sorts of players, scenarios and situations to have fun with in Association Mode (MyLeague). They really need to bring that back, so that not every player ever always looks the exact same.

A peeve of mine is that they consistently have more features and customization options all over on their console editions of the game, but refuse to transfer it over to PC. Like, no tats even? REALLY? You'be had in there on the console version of the game for YEARS, yet you still refuse to add it into the PC edition? There's no logical reasons for all of that crap. They don't even charge more for the console versions of the game over the PC version, so it is not profit-driven. It's dumb.

And this is in general - if you add the WNBA to the game, why wouldn't you just go all the way with it, and allow people to create WNBA players, too? Why only half-ass it? It's lazy and makes no sense, again.

It's the same crap every single edition, meaning every single year. They really never update, add or change anything. And the rarity they do the latter, it's usually something stupid no one really likes, like changing the controls around, and/or randomly adding or altering mechanics of play. So, 2K games are never worth the money. And to add more to it? MyCareer is also pretty much the same each year, too. But if you want the EA Lite experience, then buy the games each year, and play MyCareer each time, and pay that real world money to them to get fake money so it's actually playable and not a waste of time to play at all.

I love basketball. I love video games. At one point, NBA2K as a Franchise really couldn't do anything wrong. From 2K11 all the way to NBA2K17, a whole eight years, they made some of the best basketball games in the genre. However, from NBA2K18 onwards, it's been going all the way downhill.

Features that would appear in one title, never to return in another.
The most toxic community I've ever had the displeasure of being involved in.
Easily abused mechanics.
Current and Next Gen separations that punish you for playing on a certain console. (Occasionally the next-gen version is worse, see 2K14 on the PS3/Xbox 360/PC V it's PS4 and Xbox One counterpart.)

It's very obvious that the series, without worthy competition and with how wealthy 2K as a publisher is, this series is going to get worse.

I'm someone who has barely touched online since 2K18. I really enjoy MyLeague, as building up a team, or player for over a decade is always a really interesting premise that keeps me playing. However, it feels like I'm playing the same game from over seven years ago. 

They simply need to do better. Be more innovative, and start caring for gamemodes they haven't meaningfully touched on since NBA 2K15.

-----

Update:

Okay an additional 100 hours later.
Don't buy this game, at least for PC.

Pros: 
When not playing online, this game is great. I mainly play career mode and the ability to create a player in a position and play to the playoffs is a mostly fun experience. The neighborhood emotes and cosmetic features for the game are goofy in a fun and makes playing with your friends an enjoyable experience.

Cons: 
Career mode can get old pretty fast, and creating a new player is either a repetitive grind or a drain on the wallet. Online can be really fun, especially if you have friends to play with BUT, the park is usually filled to the brim with hackers to the point where finding a fair game is a task in itself.

General Complaining:
I wouldn't recommend playing this game, especially if you've owned any 2k since 2018. it's pretty much copy paste the only thing you'll really be getting out of this game is a very slight graphics upgrade and an updated roster. I have 2k20 on PS4 and honestly couldn't tell a difference....

...Except that for PC is filled with hackers. Epic recently breathed some new life into the game when they offered the game for free and so many new people came to the park. I thought it would be a good moment to consistently get some fair matches, but you can only play the park so much before you run into strangely unbeatable games and then realize that people hacked this game within the first 2 months of the games release.

So now for the new players to enjoy this game they turn to hacks, and the older players were already hacking , turning to hacking, or just dropping the game.

I don't really blame the new players, especially if you're new to this game which can already be somewhat technically difficult, for turning towards hacking the game. There's seemingly no repercussions and the process to reporting anyone is not exactly the easiest to do (2k requires video evidence to be recorded and sent to them). and if you play 20 games 17 of those games probably has one hacker on their team. So if you can't beat them join them I guess?

2K clearly doesn't care about the PC experience and its pretty blatant when people are using a software used to hack flash games in 2007 can be used to max out your stats and update your online rank to legend in 20mins. The game by itself has some pretty questionable mechanics before the the hackers are mixed into the equation, but the micro-transactions, mixed with general team-play toxicity, mixed with unplayable online games makes this game pretty one dimensional (offline team-play, career-mode).

Bottom Line:

If you absolutely need to get this game get it on console. It's pretty pointless to get it on PC unless you're getting it specifically to hack your stats.

I don't really recommend this game unless you got it for $10 like I did. Many reasons why obviously. 

I feel like the pros of this game have long been talked about. Most of the pros with this game are only pros because this is the ONLY basketball game with at least somewhat of a realistic vibe to it. NBA Live lacks depth in such an extreme manner, and since EA doesn't give a shizzle about actually devoting time and effort into a game to compete, and is mostly looking for a piece of the predatory monetization pie; 2K is always the superior game. Most of the pros of this game were the pros of 2k20, 2k19, 2k17... you get the idea. It's been pretty much the same game since 2k14. That's not a surprise. 

The cons set in when you realize why EA doesn't care about "competing" with 2k; Predatory monetization is in full effect here. The amount of VC you gain per game is beyond atrocious. It might be "realistic" to not become a bona-fide GOAT by the end of your first season in the NBA, but I guarantee no one cares about MyCareer to play in the NBA, they only care about the park. 2k knows this; that's why the MyCareer literally has no story now. (It's sad too, that this is actually a good thing). You are very lucky if you get 2000 VC inside of one NBA game, playing on 12 minute quarters on the easiest difficulty. You can make like; 30 threes in a game and you still probably will not get 2000 VC a game. Getting from 80 overall to 87 takes about 200000 VC; so you're looking at 100 full NBA games just to get up 7 overall. You're still not even a 90 overall yet. I imagine the VC you will make from the endorsements and daily spins might get you about from 87 to 91 or so from there. It's just ridiculous how slow you progress in this game. After about 100 hours or so, it becomes so tiresome, that you've kinda got all the entertainment out of just the offline. 

The park is not even close to being as fun. You have to fight against lag, cheesy animations, and being way underleveled than everyone else for a good 100 hours by the time you're able to catch up to your opponents. This is a game that needs an option to have skill based matchmaking, so you're able to stand a chance against your opponents. Otherwise you're stuck with 90 overall shot creators who green literally everything, and you're screwed. 

MyTeam is not fun either. The contracts are the ultimate buzzkill for the mode, and on PC; triple threat constantly crashes when you try to play it. Pack luck is just as bad as it has always been, and this mode is absolutely not Free to play, unless you actually care to waste all your free time playing it.

MyLeague is fun still. Theres a reason most NBA youtubers only play it now. It's the only mode thats not pay to win, and doesn't even require a single bit of VC to enjoy. Though the exact same exploits to build an all-time great team are still in effect, and it's limited as a result. They need to overhaul the MyLeague badly. 

Crashes are a regular feature with the PC version. You'll crash sometimes in MyCareer games, editing rosters, editing players, and more. You have to play the game at 60 fps, or else animations completely break. If that happens, why even include options to have more than 60 FPS?


It's just not fun to play this game anymore. 2K17 was my first 2k I experienced when it was online, and I admit I had quite a bit of fun, but this grind has gotten awful. I really hope someday a better alternative comes along, but I highly doubt that will ever happen. 2K used to be so great. Having made an NFL game that STILL is the best football game after 16 years. Now they're just a shell of themselves. All caught up in the awful capitalist system. They only want money. That's all they care about.

So first a little bit about me... I am no basketball nor a good NBA2K player, I never played the "Ultimate Team" Mode of the game but bought it because of the "Story Mode". But I do like watching basketball, I get the rules and I know my way around a good game so here goes my opinion.

The Movement of the players feels nice and you have great control over the players moves, the graphics is by far the best out of all major sports games respect to 2K for this achievement. However games are about more than just the looks. And I LOVE the customization from MyLeague, it is something every football and american football fan dreams about. 
The historic Teams are therre but I do miss my Charlotte Bobcats logo because that logo was dope.

Although there are bugs they mostly aren't a big problem to me at least and very infrequent.

So what is?

1. This game is a terrible peace of software. Yes bugs are very infrequent but to spot them I ave to be able to start the god damn game! Multiple times patches made it impossible for me to even start the game something I have never encountered on steam ever, I can not stress this enough.

2. While I never played the ultimate team mode it is still existent and I have big problems with the predatory selling techniques game publishers like 2K and EA use to milk their fans out of every single available cent.

3. While many things are great one thing 2k never thought of is the fact that I do not care for their god damn interviews before every single game, even worse you can not mute them, so I had to tae the hit on my eardrums every single time.

4, This is the most important part... the story. Sadly it is embaressing.
Is it better than EAs Madden Story, well yes but that is a low bar to climb, It would be like praising yourself for outrunning a 4 year old who has been tied to a pick up truck. 
I played the story multiple times in multiple ways to test it. 
It barely changes no matter what you do, the dialogues stay the same. Building your own personality is done in a 40sec interview scene as part of the draft. 
2k why do you think I would give even a remote shit about secondary characters in a story that is 2h long??? Give me inerviews let me build up my character and clash with the public, coaches and maybe even my teams because of that. I want to suffer the consequences of being an egotistical ass but playing a terrible season. Nothing like this will ever happen.

Your relationship to your agent, gf and best frenemy end in 5second cutscenes. For some reason 2k thought you need a nickname so every idiot in the story constantly refers to you as junior (just stop it 2k, a generic wow what a dunk by the center/shouting guard etc. would have been preferable)

The famous 2K story is nothing to talk about and is the main reason for my disappointment.
Still the game mechanics are pretty goodish so if you just want to play basketball you will have some enjoyable hours but for me there are still to many things lacking being the main reason I buy around 1 NBA game every 5-10 years. There should be a "maybe" option for games like these. 

On one hand, its a fairly fun game with repetitive mechanics (played all versions since 2k15 on PS4). Career mode is okay, intro story is a bit draggy and sometimes mechanics are so ridiculous (i.e. passing and intercepting etc) that it can get quite annoying. But overall, can't blame it for the rush job that it is (because of next gen, which I hear isn't a step up). 

The downside, it gets boring, fast. The career mode grind (badges and VC) is too slow which always leaves a lingering feeling of "do i want to drop more $$ for VC or just play the game". Park latency is also a problem but that's maybe because I'm in Southeast Asia. Park would be fun, if servers supported players here or maybe that's just my ISP. 

The other modes are okay, but have never tried to play with WNBA teams. 

Despite this, I will still continue to play this game. T.T

it is unfortunate that i had to make a negative review for once, despite my incredible optimism towards games. much of the game is great, the basketball works properly and the people run around. there is also fan service, as in mycareer, you have the chance to talk to women, which i truly appreciate 2k for doing. there is also great atmosphere created by the game, as mycareer lets my lanky, weak, and health-problem induced body go from a high school basketball player to the greatest to ever play the game in 2 hours. i truly believe that i can get into the nhl now because of this game. but now on to the serious issues about the game. the balancing is terrible. its very unfair that certain players are better than others. for example, this guy named "L. James" is much better than some random guy on the bench and can rail an entire team by himself (which, to be honest, was quite lovely to watch). for a company that supports the black community so much, i am disappointed in the amount of inequality between people "L. James" and "S. Curry" and the rest of his teams. finally, i am at my last complaint, my wits end — why are there no mods for removing the clothes of the players. i would certainly enjoy seeing players like tiger woods or cristiano ronaldo without any clothes, and i know im not just speaking for myself. its unbelievable that i have to play every single game while they are fully clothed. i paid 80 dollars for this game and i cannot even see my favorite men in their final form. utterly disappointing. again, i am sorry for having to release such a negative review. once all the players are balanced and i can see all of them without clothes, i will give this game a MASTERPIECE rating. bye !

this game is complete pay to win and utter trash.  and im not talking about myteam.  my issue is you cant set your own difficulty in mycareer.  i generally suck at these games and im ok with that.  i also dont care one iota about multiplayer.  i just want my created character to take the pistons to a championship.  

well, on the lowest difficulty, my shooting percentage is usually a whopping 3 percent and that is if im lucky.  doesnt matter if i time the shot perfectly..  doesnt matter if im in the paint and the shot is a layup.. its ALWAYS a bad shot according to the AI and i almost always miss.. even the simplest of layups.  the issue seems to be that im never really open.  from the vids ive seen you have to have about a foot distance between yourself and the defender.  if the shot IN ANY WAY is contested its a miss.  this gets real frustrating as i find it almost impossible to get open.  and when im on the lowest difficulty these kind of variables shouldnt be a factor.

also, you cant adjust the sliders and give yourself a handicap so you can at least have some fun in mycareer.  nope.. no fun in 2k21 it seems.  and the reason they dont allow you to adjust the sliders is because it would make the game easy.  they cant have this in mycareer because of the VC you earn.. and VC is the experience AND the premium currency.  

MLB the show does it right.  yes, they have premium currency that you can buy with real money, but you earn it in various ways.. and the boosts come through gear which is optional.. at least with the road to the show mode.  also, when i execute a good pitch or hit a base hit or homerun.. my character is rewarded with experience that will directly levels hitting.. if i strike someone out, i get experience that directly affects my pitching attributes... these experience points are completely separate from the premium currency.  and when it comes to the gear that you can buy with currency..as stated, its optional.

 and easy is easy.. medium is medium.. and hard is hard.  and just like in 2k21.. scoring in MLB the show is extremely challenging.  but only if i want it to be.  and when i play these games.. i dont have a problem with inflated stats.. also, even when the difficulty is low i still have that small amount of failure.  this option is NOT available in 2k21 mycareer and its because the experience you earn is also the premium currency they use to make money.

i tried the GM mode because it looked interesting.. but in the end i found it tedious.. and mycareer is nothing but a frustrating mess and completely not fun at all... and 100% pay to win.  challenging is fine but if im on the lowest difficulty it should be easy and not impossible.

My score… 78% overall
Graphics: 4.5/5 – Great job, but I feel like they can do better
Music/Sound: 5/5 NBA 2K has always did amazing soundtracks and
Gameplay/Plot: 3/5 - This can change depending on many factors involving your own character build and the team that you get drafted into. MyCareer has a decent story arc involving a High School and College rival, but even if you completely outperform him and win both High School and College Championships, he still gets the #1 spot on the draft which makes absolutely no sense.
Controls 5/5: - must have a controller, otherwise, I like the controls. 
Technical issues/AI issues: 2/5 - so many factors limit this, especially if you make a character that is not the best option and get drafted into a team that needs more than just you or does not need you (The AI kind acts retarded.) The game is still playable but is prone to crashes and the AI tends to not do anything for seconds at a time.
The various issues in this game is extremely comprehensive but to make a long story short, if you are just a normal casual player and not familiar what is going on currently in the NBA you are going to suffer because this game has become a Pay to Win game or Grindfest, has ineffective AI unless their ratings are higher than the other position, and the online community still has cheaters despite all the major changes to the character development and point system. 
I have played NBA 2K9 while I was on Deployment and NBA 2k14 in my first year of college, so I have some experience with this series. I have also put about 50 hours into this game in the last 2 weeks. 
In MyCareer, this game essentially forces you to do research before you create a character and drafted into a team. You essentially must know what position your team “needs” to fill before you decide what to build. And when I say “needs”, I mean you must be drafted onto the right team that requires those gaps to be filled to round out their roster otherwise you and your team is going to suffer playing against superior AI in that role because the AI simply gets stomped on. 
You must dedicate several hours watching various YouTube videos, searching web sites, and stay up to date on any trades the NBA teams. You must understand the best optimized solutions for skill breakdown, potential, wingspan, height, weight, all the badges, what team is lacking with what position/s they need. 
So, I have about 50 games into my SF build and, despite doing a bit of research, I realized that the Houston Rockets today is not the same Rockets at the start of the season. Although, at the start of the season, the Rockets had James Harden and Russell Westbrook and an entirely different starting lineup, I purchased this game a few weeks ago not realizing that the Rockets no longer has anyone on their initial starting lineup. So, we essentially have the worst team in the NBA albeit John Wall is a good Point Guard. This team needs to replace every position because everyone is in the 70s on this team. I did not realize that until after I rewatched the video and realized that the Rockets had a completely roster.
With that being said, I want to explore the complete mental retardation of the AI on a low performing team (and keep in mind, when you first start out on an NBA team, your own team almost always starts off not liking you and actively plays against you even when you are calling for passes:
1. When you go up to make a pick, these idiots hand you the ball instead of going around you or playing off you. It makes no sense! I do not even think kids do this at middle school basketball courts.
2. For some reason, when the Forwards and Centers has a lower rebounding stat than their competition, they do not try to get rebounds. I even saw one of my centers jab step away from the ball when he was literally directly below it which allowed the other teams to reach out directly above him to get the rebound. that made absolutely no sense!
3. If you stop moving around, sometimes it could take several seconds before the AI on your team to shift gears and take any type of initiative on their own. 
I am sure that I am missing many, many other issues with the AI, but those tend to happen the most.
Regardless, I did create a great 2-Way SG. But that is after watching YouTube videos for best player builds. I could imagine that this is infuriating for casual players that might not watch a whole lot of Basketball or might not play video games.
After watching a dozen videos, I created a fantastic 3-Point Sniper and Perimeter Guard and I am currently getting about 40 points, 5 assists, 3 steals, 3 rebounds per match and even made 15 3-pointers in one match. After watching the top teams team requiring a SG, I went to the Mavericks and I am currently at 30 wins and 3 losses with them so far.
Now that goes without saying, there still are issues that simply do not make any sense:
1. Even though I beat my High School/ College Rival winning both the High School and College Championships against him, he still got drafted into the NBA as Pick 1 while you are stuck at Pick 2.
2. We got drafted onto the same **** team… the Mavericks!
3. Although I did take the starter position away from the actual starting SG, the Mavs traded away Cobb! Which does not make any sense because he was the 4th best player on the team, and we had a better bench with Cobb. This team has 17 players and most of them are Guards. We need PF and another C. At least Cobb could have also fulfilled SF/SG roles and kept pounding the other times off the bench. Absolutely no sense.
4. Of course, once you start getting awards like NBA/Rookie Player of the Week/Month, the AI starts acting retarded. Instead of passing to you or setting it up to pass it to you, they start ignoring you until you start giving assists.
5. We have lost 3 times simply because the AI quit moving. As in, they simply are not responding to stimulation allowing the other team rebounds and make easy buckets with no defense.
The issue in this game is not just with the AI… it is also technical issues as well:
1. This game crashed on me 3 times so far. After I had amazing matches and I get a ton of points and fans, the game seems to like crashing right before post game sponsorships send you messages congratulating you. I am not sure if that is what the issues is, but I feel like that is the source. 
2. For some reason, I cannot logon to the MyNBA2K21 app and website because my Steam account is somehow not registered… so I cannot upload my own designs or my Face…
Now, I have not even tried to play online with The Neighborhood, MyTeam, or MyNeighborhood but at this point it is a pay to win game.
I understand that this game has a history with cheaters. I like the concept of badges, point development, and requiring your character to level up through MyCareer to develop their character, but I just saw a guy on MyNeighborhood with a rating of 255 when the max rating should be 99.
If you do not create a decent MyCareer character and get him on a decent team, your progress, adding points, and even getting badges will go slower than if you created a overpowered character. $50 for 200,000 VC points though.
Otherwise, my main guy gets about 1120 VC per game so to get 200,000 VC points without spending money will take 178 games. My other guy is lucky to get 600 VC.
It really depends on whether you want to grind out the game or not… because you will.
Anyway, I love the NBA Quickplay and the WNBA is a great addition. Still, the core of the game is essentially Pay to Win, filled with ineffective AI, and online is filled with people who have played for years.

I might consider a positive review if this game stops crashing. I'll play the first half, then it will, for no reason at all begin to buffer/lag, dropping from 50 FPS to suddenly .5 FPS. I then go through this long process of rebooting windows, verifying integrity of game files, updating drivers, maybe restarting again... Then after 20 minutes of troubleshooting it works again. Then I play for an hour or two, same thing happens again  Absolute joke. This has happened roughly 6-7 times in 14 hours of playtime so far.

Every couple of years I say "Screw this I'll never get 2k again" because each year I don't play it more than other games I like. Meanwhile the game seems to somehow get worse. Then one day I'll see it on sale for like $10. I'll then think to myself "Screw it I'll give 2k a shot again." after all it was my favorite game from about 2k13-17. "$10 isn't to bad maybe ill get a few fun hours out of this." Once again buying it on sale was a mistake. I  should have bought another $10 DLC for one of my strategy games. At least when I bought 2K19 it ran. I didn't enjoy it, but I didn't have to reboot every couple of hours to get it to work.
The game is decent

[h1]I wish I could place a positive review but I simply can't. Here are the reasons why:[/h1]

[h1] Cons [/h1]
[olist]
    [*] First off, as others pointed out as well, it is the same game with the last year. Some of you may argue that "what might they could possibly change?", well let me tell you. MyCareer is everything to this game and it should be the main focus of developers. As soon as you step out of collage and enter the NBA with your character, all the fun ends [b]COMPLETELY.[/b] 
    [*] Yes, the fun ends. You might again come up with All-Stars and Play Off's, but really. Even if you perform superb in those, all you get a record in your career book. Not a single reward, not a cut scene, nothing at all regarding the story. This is [b]RIDICULOUS.[/b] 
    [*] You start playing MyCareer with "PRO" difficulty. As you progress along, you find that this difficulty is quite easy and you want to see some more. However, when you increase the difficulty of game in MyCareer, you immediately realize the mistake you have done. The diffuculty curve is beyond exponential. The defence and offence you are facing becomes  [b]RIDICULOUS[/b]. Meanwhile, your cursed goat herding team stays the same, allowing every score, and not improving as you raise the difficulty.
    [*] Some players are ridiculously OP. Doncic, D'Angelo Russel, Antetekoumpo cannot be defended on difficulties "All-Star" and beyond.
    [*] Commentators did a good job overall yet they give same reaction whether an AlleyHoop is a monster kind or it is a weak, "Lay Up" type. This is not amusing. 

[h1]Pros [/h1]
     [*] It is an NBA game and we love it.
[/olist]

Now, I am sincerely not happy to criticize this much, yet I believe that the game would be a masterpiece if developers start to consider some of the feedback. Maybe instead of launching the same game every damn year, they might improve the points that I mentioned above. 

They already update the game frequently with the roster etc. Maybe they can launch NBA 2K franchaise every 2 or 3 year. But nah, they earn tons of money aren't they. Then again, if they would do that by any chance, they'll avoid [b]Mostly Negative[/b] reviews.

I don't know guys. I still love the game but I feel like the good effort is wasted meaninglessly. If even a casual player like me who has literally no expertise with developing game can state these problems with ease, then there is something going wrong.


*UPDATE*

Sports games are some of the few that insist on a yearly release. In the past, this made sense. Without internet access, it was the only way to give updated yearly rosters. Since the advent of the modern console, that problem can be completely eradicated. Unfortunately, the greed surrounding these franchises keeps subpar games like this coming.

This game is not the "next gen" version. This makes little sense considering PCs are not locked into older hardware, but I digress. You will not get access to the cool new cities. Yes, there is a new layout. No, there are no functional changes outside of that since last year. The few changes i noticed were missing cut scenes. When you enter stores you are no longer greeted. There is no pregame show this season either. Shaq and Kenny make a couple guest announcing appearances but its not the same.

My biggest problem is that the controls are not as fluid as last year. The pro stick consistently wants to do dribble moves instead of taking a shot. I didn't have this issue last year. It makes the game nearly unplayable and Ive gone back to 2k20 a few times just to clear my frustration.

Its hardly worth the discounted price i paid for it, and I certainly wouldnt be happy if I had paid the full 60. I already feel like I paid money for a giant advertisement.

best game ever

I'm coming from NBA 2K15. I never participate in online play. I just wanted something where I could scan in faces and make a custom team with my friends and family and play locally. I'm such a dupe to have fallen for this product. 

1. The game doesn't have a built-in way to remove MyPlayer and the related face scan. Not only that, I've hunted for a hack to do this and can't find it. There are tons of instructions for resetting a face (deleting the saved data) on console versions, but similar instructions are not existent for the PC version.

[Edit to Review]: Scanning a new face can be done in MyCareer for the player that was built. So, I was mistaken on this, thankfully.
2. It made a silly looking version of me. If I could've made some minor tweaks to the eye tilt, the chin size, it would've been alright. But, there were no such touch-up options. Your stuck with only the software's interpretation.

[Edit to Review]: This was corrected by rescanning my face while filling up more of the circle. So much so, that when I turn my head, my child goes out of the rotation. I look much closer to normal now.
3. BIGGEST ISSUE FOR ME: The game only allows a single person's face to be scanned in. I bought this hoping to scan in the face of my friends and family and build a custom team with all of us and enter an offline MyLeague with it. Frankly, I will never buy NBA 2K again until this feature exists. I simply don't understand why the face scan isn't built into the Create-A-Player. If anyone has a hack around this, let me know.
4. Not a big deal, but still a problem: MyPlayer should allow users to decide whether or not they want to max out the players. I wouldn't do that, but real superstars come into the league with ratings in the 80-90s. Start with some limited default, but allow users the freedom to override it. Different aspects of MyCareer are attractive to different users. Grinding from nobody just isn't fun for me.
[Edit to Review]: You can boost your ratings really quickly, if you're willing to pay a lot of money. Obnoxious and not worth it. Still a negative for me.
5. Here's another huge negative for me now that I've played a little: they still haven't provided a way to turn off the cheerleaders. I hate having this indecency in the game and want the option to turn it off. I've reported this in prior versions, and hoped that after 6 years they would've provided this ability in the graphics settings. They just don't seem to care that they're keeping customers away who are offended by this.

If anyone has help, please provide it. For those of you playing an older version simply looking for what I was looking for, be content with what you have and don't waste your time. Just keep playing MyLeague on the version where you've invested so much time.

My experience  is that this is my first NBA and gotta say it is worth every penny.
I was afraid not to buy this game for bad comments but i have said what the hell i will buy it.
I do not have problems with crashes for 3.5 hours, all went well.
My Configuration is Amd Ryzen 5 2400g, rx590 8gb, 16 gb ram, ain"t super gaming rig but it is all right.
My advice is if you are interested for buying another game this is quite good and tense game especially for the last seconds where you can lose the game.
The flaws of this game are some defined which i am going to write down.
1 - My career mode is extremely slow and basically you have to pay for upgrades if you want to upgrade fast, otherwise you will have to grind a lot  of time to be a good player with good statistic because it is expensive.
2 - Other players in my career mode are sometimes glitched to hold the ball too much time and you are loosing the attack, and as well the story is quite good and interest but after couple of hours it gets a boring for me at least, it does not have to be boring for you, do not wanna spoil things here.
And that is all, overall this game is good for just substitute some other games for an example i am taking rest from call of duty and wanna change the genre completely, some glitches i did not have but for now it is all great.
My opinion is this is just a game so do not expect the perfection because after all it is just a game, ain"t a real life.
As i said upon for me works properly enough and do not have crashes. or any kind of fps drop.
For the closure this game is just fine and the most important thing buy it on the discount, never pay full price because game does not have too much things for 60 euros, i do not know how much exactly it costs but for the price below 10 euros is great.
Have a nice day people, enjoy :)

The key to this game giving a good return on expectations is to buy it on sale.  It's worth it at a $10 purchase price.  I personally would not pay for it at full price, but that's just because I'm a filthy casual and not really a hardcore gamer.  I only play MyCareer on the 2K games with one player and then pretty much stop playing a few years into the career.  2K really is a grind, and I really only play to blow off steam.  But that's on me and not the fault of the game devs.

Too many reviews give too little credit to how much actually goes into producing a game like this, and expect new bells and whistles every release over incremental changes to critical things like the physics engine.  A telling sign that most of the negative reviews are just people who don't actually understand the game development process and are just being petulant is the fact that they all keep buying 2K every year and have hundreds of hours played.

I can definitely understand the frustration of paying $60 + however else much you pay to buy VC's to upgrade your character every single year for a product that appears to have only incremental (if at all) improvements.  But the solution isn't to shit on the developer.  It's to just...not buy the game until its on sale.  If enough of you dissatisfied players would do that, you'd actually see more change.

The game itself runs great on PC. Never had a 2k on PC before, just consoles. That being said, the community seems way strong on consoles, and MyCareer on PC seems super lackluster. All of the "road to the NBA" stuff is alright, but once you're in there's no real cutscenes or anything really interesting. Even the endorsements have don't seem to have any agent meetings. I'm actually not sure if this is a PC specific thing, but I played 2k20 a ton on console and it was far more consistent. 
EDIT: After experiencing a little more, you automatically "attend" events for the endorsements, so none of those cool Beats events with cutscenes. Still no agent meeting cutscenes, just pickup VC from the front door. So while it's all very shallow and the actual tangible results are there, still pretty lame to have limited to no cutscenes like prior console experiences. So, fun to play, i'll probably keep putting hours, worth the $10 when it's on sale, but otherwise wouldn't recommend.

Bottom line, this game is just not fun, and fun factor is definitely important when it comes to video games. I'm currently playing and enjoying NBA 2k17, and unfortunately I have come to the  sad conclusion that NBA 2k17 is superior to nba 2k21. The shooting is way too difficult and the graphically for some reason the game feels old. The only thing which I am enjoying about 2k21 is the wnba which is not available in 2k17, otherwise let's just hope that 2K22 will be a better game.

Stuff that they copy-pasted from 2k20
1- Starting cutscenes of every game. Player behaviours, team mascots, the crowd, Commentaries of announcers.
2- The tweets which are in-game and off-game from the crowd/fans. Same as 2k20.
3- The whole commentary of the games, copy-pasted.
4- Team Practices. Same.
5- Cpu-player movements (NPCs) are the same. The interactions between themselves in-game. Defense and offense movements, the playbooks they use, same...
6- The endorsement offers. They disabled the cutscenes. The offers are the same, copy-pasted.
7- The shoe creating or editing. Same.
8- Neighbourhood. Same. Nothing except from how it looks is changed.
9- The moves you pull in-game, park or nba-on-court, SAME.
10- VC rewarding system :) every bit of it is the same.
11- Character creation, every bit of code is the same.
12- "Setting up your potential" copy-pasted. Every part of it.
13- I didn't win a championship but I am guessing if you do, the resulting cutscenes are probably the same. Maybe they fixed the No-Sound issue :) I doubt it.
14- In myCareer; "My Minutes", "My Stats", "Team Stats", "Player Stats" all the menus are the same. I don't know how they could've changed them though, but still, seeing the same font in everything :) kinda funny.
15- The Progression menu. Exactly the same. Badges too. Nothing is changed.
16- From what I've heard, the park is the same too. All of the items you can buy, Daily-Spin, cheaters too, they are all the same.

----- These are the ones 11 hours of gameplay showed me. Now let's look at the pros :)

1- The game is smoother, no fps drops with gtx 1060 16gb RAM, i7 7700K and installed on an SSD.
2- The bug where you had to alt+tab to fast-forward to sub-in to the game, is gone. They fixed it finally. Now after you sub out, you just press Space and it works.
3- The discount was good :) 8 dolars is a good price for an update for the 2k20.

This game is nowhere near deserving the $50 or more. They just used "ctrl+A" then "ctrl-V". Then they used "ctrl-F" to find the cutscenes and deleted them. Nothing more believe me. These companies are getting bold to present such games with such prices.

I remember when 2K14 first released on next-gen, everyone was excited for the future of this game series because they were constantly improving. We had faith in devs and for a while, we kept this faith because they were constantly releasing better games. For the last couple years however they have released horrible copy and paste games and we can't even expect the devs to put in a new jersey if a team announces it. We can't rely on the devs to update any gamemodes except MyCareer, and MyCareer is the most ass its ever been. MyLeague has never been touched in the last 5 years, MyGM is a joke, and MyTeam is pay to win. If this is your first 2k game you'll have fun, but i recommend getting 2k20 and just modding that because they literally made it impossible to get any great mods on this version of 2k. 2k20 mods made 2k20 enjoyable, but now we can't even mod in old school rosters into this years edition. Please don't pay more than 15 dollars for this game.

While I hate that next gen isn't out on PC, NBA 2K21 does have some upsides compared to the previous installment. MyLeague is still busted in some ways but sliders are starting to stabilize, tendencies are somewhat fixed and it's still a better experience than MyCareer or MyTeam. Downloading cyberfaces has been made easier, but it's a little bit more tedious since the 2kTools only allow you to put cyberfaces on current NBA players or custom draft class players instead of just being able to assign any player a cyberface ID. Otherwise, it's a solid game for people who like the simulation aspect of NBA 2K.

If you are a fan of the MyLeague feature of NBA 2k games as I am, do NOT purchase this game. I payed full price to play this game for the sole purpose of redesigning the 30 NBA teams and simulating them. At first this process will work fine, but after a certain amount of uniforms or arenas are redesigned, the game will give you an error stating it cannot save the design. I have searched for fixes to the issue, and none exist.

TLDR: MyLeague is fundamentally broken and literally won't let you completely redesign all the teams.

Game developers are still obviously extremely lazy when it comes to creating decent AI. So instead, on harder difficulties they make every opposing player a blend of LeBron, Curry and Giannis, and every player on my team, even star players who are amazing IRL, a mindless donkey. I wouldn't even mind the opposing team scoring EVERY TIME if my team at least TRIED to defend. They don't. The opponent seems to literally just run into the paint and score over my C every time. Or get fouled. Or both. That's fine. What isn't fine is Nikola Vucevic and Zach LaVine averaging 13 FG% on the goddamn season. It absolutely doesn't matter how open any of my teammates are. They WILL miss. The times they score is when they are absolutely open in the paint and the game mechanics literally don't allow them to miss. If this is the idea of making the game more DIFFICULT, then the standards are at an all time low when it comes to making a good game. The worst part is that people will defend this and say "gEt gOoD". (People seem to confuse "difficult" with "completely BS") I score 60+ points every match, and even then it's not a sure win. First of all I don't want to have to score that much every time, it kills realism. If I switch to an easier difficulty, I will win every game by 50+. I don't want that either. I want a good challenge that is also fair. Can't have that with this game. Overall, I absolutely do not recommend this game (for MC at least, I don't play other modes).
