The game is the same as pretty much every other year. Yes the gambling & "in game purchases" are HEAVILY thrown in your face. But it is fun and will keep you playing regardless.

However they are NOT updating this version to the "Next Gen" version so you will not be getting anything other then what's here already. They don't seem to have any plans to release the Next Gen version either.

Though a VERY sore spot for me is ALL of my files got "corrupted" and wiped. I lost a TON of MP progress & earned VC because of that. Even after making a help ticket all I got was a wordy professionally written "oh well".

Because of that, I can't recommend the game.

It's not so much that this is a bad basketball game. It definitely has it's merits. But it heavily depends on what you want out of a basketball game that will determine if you will enjoy it.

In short, if you want a multiplayer, online, competative, balanced basketball experience, do NOT pick this up.
If you want to play the next gen version of the game, do NOT pick this up, maybe next year.

But if you want to just either make your own player, grind your way up through the NBA, and ignore the multiplayer component, it's not half bad, it's okay. It's even okay if you go into the MyTeam mode of PC, so long as you stick to the single player mode, since the currency, MT, is way easier to obtain and the cards seem to go for cheaper based on what I've seen in the PS5/4 market.

But still expect the overall feeling from the devs that they just don't care, this especially is true if you played previous years, where the more immersive side of the game was sort of expected to be there, making them stick out with their omission. Things like adding shoes as the season goes on (they heavily push other clothes for mp only though) your mycareer character interacting with other nba stars on the regular, the pregame show featuring Shaq. 

It all manages to feel barebones, but typically during this time of year I see this title for $20 or less, which if you are new I think is worth it, sink your hours to it, then maybe see if next year's version improves or not. That being said, always expect multiplayer to be trash on PC, not to mention one of the more toxic communities I've ever witnessed.

I'll just stick to single player myteam thank you very much.

TL;DR: The game is fun, but if you're someone that wants a clean, un-glitchy, servers running, no hackers, basketball minded game... This isn't it for you.

The game 2K21 is fun. It's very fun. I play the MyPlayer and Park mode exclusively. It's very fun. I like leveling up my, MyPlayer, and working on him for wins and eternal glory.

But heres the shit part, about 95% of time time, I'm dealing with a problem that this game has. The servers crash, the servers are bugged and I'm frozen and need to restart. There are hackers on every other court, making the game impossible for new people, and extremely difficult and unfun for the veterans of the park. 
It's so annoying how a HUGE game like 2K, that just gets SLAMMED with money from VC, can't update and fix their game. It's astonishing. 
If more people would subject themselves to this form of torture, there would be a GoFundMe page right now for the developers, so they can be paid to fix this shit.
Honestly, if 2K was ran and designed by an honest to good company. This would be one of the, if not THE best sports game on the market. But when it's better then Madden (Not saying much) and there is no other equal or close competitor to 2K... You have to just suck it up or pass it up.

3/10, enjoyable offline experience. I got the game for $20 and do feel that I overpaid.

Took me over an hour to get the game to work. Was a nightmare to troubleshoot and honestly not sure what fixed it. Had a patch that was stuck at zero the moment the game booted and could not play until it was done. 

Online is terrible, empty compared to console and full of cheaters.

I bought it looking for an offline experience for mycareer/mygm, first time since '18. Once I got the game working, it has been smooth as butter and I haven't really had any glitches aside from one practice drill bugging out. 

MyGM seems a bit watered down compared to what I remember, but it has been years so I could be wrong. Not a fan of the new AP system they use.

MyCareer seems to be a pretty big improvement from what I remember. Grind is still really bad. Story is still bad but is a lot better than 16/17/18 and there are far less cutscenes. Once you get to the NBA its pretty much done which was a very welcome change. On a second character I had the option to jump straight to the NBA and skip the story.

Though the player model improvements are nominal, MOVEMENT and contact with opponents is vastly improved.  it's harder to shoot with the meter than ever before....because they want you to TURN IT OFF and play it old school, release as close as you can to the top of the jump.  defense for the AI has improved, and god help you if you are playing against one of the top 20 in the league; they're going to hit you for 40 every time.  you can't spam pick and roll anymore, and trying to drive baseline on the fast break has also been fixed so it's not a guaranteed 2 every time.  ppl who are complaining about the difficulty....welcome to old school basketball video gaming in the 21st century.

Although this game had so many negative reviews, i still bought it. Many people say that it has so many bugs, online servers are trash, do not buy this game. And i 30% agree. It does not have THAT many bugs that people said, like i only encountered 2 or 3 in OFFLINE game. It does not have THAT shitty server that people are saying. Some say that it is laggy, some say that i have latency delay, some say that it crashes during online play and etc. Me, personally have not encountered any of these problems. BUT problem is that if you live in a shitty region like me (Georgia) your ping might be high, that's all, and i play on 75hz monitor but sometimes in the Neighborhood or online 5v5 it caps at 60hz. idk why but still, it's not trash game and if you want to buy it, i recommend you to buy it on a sale. i've bought it 10$ on sale and i am pleased with it.

Positiv:
- Story of career mode is very good. Videos & telling is nice.
- Game seems to be stable no crashings so far, not like 2k20 where at least one crash on 1 hour playingtime is normal.
- Streetbasketball is good playable camparing to 2k20, no or less lagging animations on court. 
- Grafik seems to be a bt better specially to colors and shadows are more reallistic and not eye destroying (too dark, too bride) like in nba 2k20.
- NO HELI and no other noisy sound on court to let your cry or rip of your headphones!!!

Negativ:
- Comparing to 2k20 the career mode is destroying the game now. Pick & roles or other playbooks are not possible to execute now, because defender is so fast he can avoid the screen 100% and other obstacles easy. But your own teamplayers are screening you %100 and slow you down by bumping you around in defence. 
- All attack action seems to be random & lucky. Your defender is allways in front of you no matter what, no fake moves are working agaist npc defender even with eurostep you can not loose your very fast npc defender. Movment of npc defenders looking very unrealistic too fast and overdrived.
- npc are fouling a lot more than in 2k20. Most of the game you do freeshots - make it boring!!!
- gameplay seems pre scripted. If game decide your not getting ther rebound/ball you dont even if u stand beside it clearly nearest to it. The npc gets ball even far away from it.
In one word stupid NPC with no AI just scripted moves and position is not relevant for getting the ball.

Finally:
I recomment playing career mode in 2k20 if and neighbourhood in 2k21.
But buying this game isnt worth it. Like in 2k20 cheaters are destroying the game fun in neighbourhood. 
2k is not reallising that those cheaters destroying the image of nba 2k. Dont wanna buy nba 2k games anymore. Cant recomment buying it!!!!

2k is the only good simulation game for basketball out there.  It's scary actually how good and realistic that engine is; however, for the PC it's ass.  Yes, I realize I have played quite a bit of this writing a "not recommended" to get.  

This is only because of 2 things: as others have pointed out, PC users were shafted for the next gen jump.  Oh well, it's still the best steam has to offer.  But secondly and even more importantly, this game has so many annoying crashes. 

I play 2k21 for its MyLeague feature for 90% of my game played time and I can't tell you how often I have to save because the game just continues to crash even after I try everything to fix the issue like clear the cache, turning V-Sync on and off, etc.  It's random and will continue to happen until 2k addresses the issue which if we go back to my first point, you'll get your answer. 

I had no problem playing this game on any other mode with crashes.  Although I did experience a really flawed bug when on MyCareer.  If you have VSync off, you can't simulate to your next appearance.   

Get this hesitantly or when it's on sale. 

If the game wasn't broken/buggy: 8/10
but because it's a re-hash of 2k18-20 AND there's near game breaking bugs, 4/10

I have no idea why the negative reviews. Either people on here have faulty pc's, hate just for pure pleasure, or simply they're talking about past problems. I consider myself lucky if that is the case, because I am having an absolute blast. My pc is kicking this game's butt, I have pretty much transformed this game to NBA 2K21 next gen. The modding community is amazing. Even without mods this game looks beautiful. I've read some reviews on where people say shooting in this game is bad/hard, that's funny, shooting in this game is not only easy but easy to master as well. Learn the game, and stop shooting like crazy. Remember, don't expect Shaq to hit a 3, if that's what you're trying to do LOL I havent played an NBA game since NBA 2K7, considered by most, THE BEST, NBA 2K game, and I must say, I enjoyed the heck out of NBA2K7, BUT, this game right here, its something else. Call me bootlicker or whatever, but 2K have out done themselves with this title. That being said, a game with more negative reviews than positive reviews, doesn't always mean is a BAD game, at least on my end. Good thing I didn't let negative reviews make my decision on whether buying this game or not. 

PS: I've played WNBA league, MyTeam, and I have not experienced a single crash. I've read some reviews stating this game crashes on launch, and I have 6hrs in the time of this review, and does 6hrs have been of pure joy and entertainment. More than likely this game had a massive update I don't know about, but whatever. I love it! :) you that read me, don't let negative reviews scare you away. The "risk" is worth IT!

This game has way too many issues but I will focus solely on the MyTeam game mode. I love the idea of MyTeam and it's what I've been playing all these hours. Now you may be wondering, 300+ hours at the time of this review? I haven't owned 2K before so I'm making up for lost time. I'm also a sucker for grinding out things to get players and some of the players are a joy to play with. But to really have any meaningful progress in MyTeam, you'll have to play online. This is where the game goes straight into the gutters of hell.

1. Matchmaking - League of Legends has better matchmaking than this absolute garbage. I've been meaning to review this game for a while but it took me playing this guy EIGHT straight times in a row on Triple Threat Online to get me on here. I pay no money outside of the original purchase of this game. This other guy I've now somehow queued up against EIGHT STRAIGHT TIMES? He/She clearly has poured some money into this game like 99% of the PC players who play online (Pink Diamond players). Does 2K have zero idea on matching their player base to equivalent team skill? It's absolutely ridiculous. Also, why is the lag on this game so horrible? Which brings me to my next point. 

2. Pay to Win: even though you (now) mistakenly have this game, it means nothing because you'll have to grind countless hours JUST to have an inferior team when compared to other players who play online. This "pay to win" issue is absolutely tragic because of the matchmaking issue above. If you ever want to experience how this is broken, let me give you some examples.
- Pink Diamond (PD) Steph Curry consistently out-rebounding my center who is actually decent (Diamond Javale McGee, Diamond Hakeem, etc). I even get into a good rebounding position and he'll just either out-rebound me or tap it out, at which point your "inferior" players will just struggle.
- Your "great" defensive player who consistently get blown by when staring across a higher rated player. 92-94 power forwards and centers consistently get dunked on by point guards launching from 8-10 feet away from the basket.
- Your amazing point guard who has the "unpluckable" badge will consistently cough the ball up to superior, higher rated players. I'm sorry Jason Kidd, I've never seen you cough the ball up so many times in the span of 30 seconds. 

3. Ah the last main point. This game has a steep learning curve and the "mechanics" of this game are just horrible. In Triple Threat especially, you can never get your teammates to do what you want. 
- No three seconds in the key. What is wrong with 2k here? Did they just forget to code this? They patch the game and make you download it almost every day. Can they not fix that?!?
- Pick and roll mechanics do not work. I will call for a fade on the PNR and they will roll EVERY. SINGLE. TIME.
- Get used to every player being on skates. This is 2K on Ice baby.

There is no way I would recommend this game to someone looking to enjoy this game. All this game is good for is for is to play against friends using the standard NBA teams. If you've read this far along and wondering why I am still putting hours into this game, it's because I love the NBA and I'll suffer through this game to collect players. That last sentence reads wrong but I hope you understand what I mean. The other thing I find funny is just watching my players do these silly things. It's funny if YOUR Steph Curry out-rebounds every single player in the game, but it's just miserable having that happen to you. I once read a comment that this game is "so realistic" but nothing could be further from the truth. The exact thing that makes this game so laughable is that it's so unrealistic. Players shoot 40% at best from three even when they're wide open in real life, but not in 2K. If you're in a hot zone and playing against a 95+ rated player, GG. That player is unstoppable. They will instantly be on fire and your entire team will go ice cold. How demoralizing. Oh and as a "no money spent player" the free 95+ rated players are not the same as the 95+ rated players you get from packs. 

It's so sad to me that there isn't a competitor out there because I love basketball and I love the NBA. The game in real life deserves better a better representation and so do the fans. Justice will unlikely be granted in my lifetime but this ends my rant. Thanks for reading all the way through!
-------------

This game is still trash. There's all these broken mechanics that allow for so minimal counter play. And I swear this is no moderation on hacks because there be players greening fadeaways multiple times in a row and contested shots. Part of it is the servers. I love basketball. 2k destroys everything I enjoy about the sport. This game makes me want to go live in the mountains. it is so unplayable it makes the devs look more insane than asylum patients.
Edit: I grew up playing and watching basketball and to this day it is still my favorite sport and is the only reason i continue to buy year to year. That being said, these mongoloids we call developers need to all be fired and a new team be installed. Since launch there has been a very bad crashing issue for pc when trying to load into a game. You could load up the main menu and go into whatever mode you want to play, but the second you start loading into the game to play, boom crashes. I have found no update or even 3rd party program that can fix it. You would expect a company to fix the issues with its game in a timely manner. No. Rather than that 2k devs are too busy rolling around on the floor screaming at the ceiling because they are mentally insane. Never have I seen such a piss poor execution of a game that they copy and paste every single year. At this point a singular developer from the Cyberpunk project has more brain cells than the entire 2k team collectively. With all due disrespect, sell the company and fire the development team. UPDATE 2/26/21: I forgot to complain about how in MyPlayer as a reserve you'll always play against your opponent's starters instead of, you know, like in real life - the other team's reserves. Not only is that fundamental to NBA strategy, it's something that wasn't screwed up in other titles. How lazy do you have to be to not bother programming rotations just because eventually your player will start so - I dunno - why even bother? This is truly a shameful title. I wish I could unrecommend it even harder. This deserves some fire borders with little devil emojis doing horrible things to the 2K logo.

I'm surprised I haven't noticed before how abundantly, unforgivingly slanted this is for PVP play - and all of that feeds into the pay-to-win / microtransaction setup for this game. It turns out there are no microtransactions (outside of stat improvements) for the meat of the game - NBA play. As such, the title basically ignores the NBA. Most of the videos that play while loading the game are related to highlights from the park (or other non-NBA venues), or PVP tournaments, or which new avatar enhancement can be bought, or highlights from PVP events. Alternatively, there are entire videos dedicated to which colored jewel cards are available and how they'd be useful for PVP play.

This isn't an NBA title. This is a PVP title that needs the NBA to make it relevant. As one of the many players who couldn't care less about PVP I'm upset I have to endure all the useless nonsense spoon fed to us to try and coax money from our wallet. I wonder if there could be two basketball games - one for fans of the NBA and one for fans of blue afros and vanity Christmas sweaters. I wonder which would sell more.
 
I pick up this title annually. After bad reviews and noting it was last gen for the PC I waited for it to be $20 USD. It's still horrible. It's the worst version of this game I've played in recent memory. My expectations for it weren't even high (thanks COVID) and it still failed to meet them.

Yeah, it had a knock against it for being last gen. There's no excuse for disrespecting PC gamers. Consoles are for kids who can't afford PCs. So this is the same game as it has been for the last couple years. I play MyPlayer and MyLeague, but I haven't started the league yet.

The story was weak. What follows are spoilers, but it's hard to spoil what's barely there. The character who could but doesn't have daddy issues is perpetually compared to his high school / college star father who died somehow. You stop playing football to pursue basketball for reasons that no one says in your senior year. Your coach and not-really-mentor have beef that isn't explained. You go to college, you date a national soccer player for Canada, she leaves to pursue her dream and you go to the pros. That's basically it.

During that slog you're pretty horrible. I made a 3 & D wing who couldn't shoot (nothing new there, thanks a lot 2K). Bored with his lack of ability I switched to a two-way slasher. At least he can score. Your ratings start in the 40s (the 40s! A new low!) and with investment of earned VC they make it to 50 to 60. Then, at a 65-ish rating (artificially buffed, none of your scores are 65) you enter the pros as the second pick in the draft.  Normally I'd grind the league for a bit to buff my player with earned VC but this year I just wanted to play basketball. If you skip the story you start at a 60 rating with no badges.

I get on my favorite RL team and it doesn't play at all like the real team. It doesn't run any offense - again nothing new, the game still wants you to call the plays. As such, my RL rookie-of-the-year contender doesn't use his should-be gold rated floater because the offense is stagnant. Two guys on the block, two guys at the top and you. No movement. One screen per possession unless you call them. So yeah, my favorite team got disrespected by 2K.

You might assume that's a thing across the league, right? That every team was short changed? Wrong. Brooklyn has its super team - based on a trade made after release in January. So 2K, thirsty for love from casual fans, catered to bandwagon players by forcing a roster change mid-season while completely ignoring how actual teams failed to live up to their RL counterparts. That's pretty bad 2K. It gets plenty of money from this title, it doesn't have to release trash.

I forgot to complain about how your character spawns next to the PVP courts and has to jog to the team facility every time if he (or she? Maybe?) wants to practice with the team and get better. It takes maybe 30 seconds to run there. So over an 80 game season that's 40 minutes wasted. Over a 10-year career (not gonna happen) that would be - quick math here - 400 minutes of just running from a place I don't want to be to a place I want to be? Why, so I can see advertisements? Get over yourself 2K.

Wait for 2K21. Hopefully that'll be next gen. At least those animations look compelling and new.

Oh hey there, I see you've passed it to your center wide open under the hoop. Now, he has two options: 
1) lay it up quickly or dunk
2) get commando blocked from the away team's center who was looking the other way, is flat footed, and should be slow as shit.

If you thought number 2 happened, you're right!

That wasn't a one off, either. Stuff like that happens constantly. It feels like they tried to make the game "harder" by making involve more arcade elements versus actually trying to make the AI smarter. The court feels small.

Honestly, I have no idea how they made the game worse. I never play online because the servers are trash, and I usually go to bat for this game because the offline gameplay is great, but this is just bad. Between the shot mechanics being worse, no matter if you have the "aim" feature off, the AI somehow being stupider, or players teleporting to others on defense, this game feels worse than the NHL series when the last console switch happened. 

Yes, it's that bad. 

I really hope 2K gets their act together. They make enough money off all the damn microtransactions they've put in the game. Maybe they don't care about the offline gamer, the mycareer and franchise gamer. They aren't on EA's level of stupidity, but they are getting close. 

They either need to start cleaning house, telling people to step it up, or just admit all they care about are the MyTeam players. 

It's not worth it at full price, it's not worth it on sale. If it was 10 bucks, I guess pick it up. 

Massive disappointment.

Recommendation based on my personal experience: a longtime NBA fan who hasn't played an NBA 2k game in many years, enjoying MyCareer offline and an occasional Exhibition against the computer or online with real teams. I can't comment on the lack of updates, the fact it isn't a next-gen version, or the cheaters/crappy online servers. As a basketball game for a basketball fan who wants a casual experience, this is a top notch game that I'm enjoying immensely. The MyCareer stuff can have some wonkiness to it with lineups and the story (no spoilers), but I'm living my dream. Will I buy this again next year? I don't know, it depends on the updates that are made and how I'm feeling, but for $20 on sale it's a definite recommend for anyone like me.

For $20, I thought it would be worth a try.  I remember enjoying 2k10 & 2k11 back in the day.

I was wrong.  The reviews are right.  The PC version has multiple issues that apparently have gone unresolved for years.  If you run in the game above 60fps (which it explicitly allows), you get soft locked any time you sit on the bench.  People reported that bug for 2k20 and it was never fixed.

Outside of the issues, the blatant monetization of every aspect of the MyCareer mode frequently left me shocked.  Attempting to play without purchasing VC is a miserable experience.  Not only does your player move slow, loses the ball, misses wide open shots, but the story of the game consistently berates you for your performance.  There is nothing like grinding your way through an 1/7 FG game where the commentators are constantly talking about how Junior is a "failed, disappointing prospect".  Or how the game introduces a rival character that literally represents you if you had purchased VC.  Or how they introduce team practice drills that can only be completed by higher level characters.  So much of the game is about dangling nice things in front of you, and then shaking a money can in your face afterwards.

By the way, if you don't want to half-ass it and max out your MyCareer character, you would need to drop $100 on VC.  If you drop $100 on a character that isn't perfectly built, you don't get it back.  Also, VC doesn't carry over to next year.  So they literally want people to spend $100 per character, per year.  For a game that has bugs that are multiple years old.

Unfortunately, the worst of the game appears long after 2 hours have passed.  I have submitted a refund request despite, hopefully Steam will be lenient.  I feel horrible for anyone that paid full price for this.

First and foremost, this game is comprised of really frustrating game play. Shooting only works with near to perfect execution. Only rigid adherence to one or two approaches will result in more than a snowball's chance in hell of making a field goal- leaving no room for any type of fun or creativity. 
On defense your player defends like they're on an ice rink with no skates.

This feels much more like work than play.

Virtual currency feels a bit grindy, but pales in comparison to these other issues. 

I haven't purchased an NBA 2k title since 2013. I bought this one on sale, and against my better judgment. I love basketball, and was lured in by the siren song of what this title emulates. The problem is that it's like a serial killer wearing the skin of someone you love.
Next time, I'll listen to my instincts. 
I would strongly discourage anyone on the fence from buying this phoned-in nightmare.

Another year, another absolutely shit game from 2k. The fact that we as PC players literally get a fraction of the full game people on the console get should be bad enough, but the array of bugs and crashes that make this game unplayable are absolutely disgusting. You're all a sick, awful excuse for a development company, and we buy into it every single year because it's all we have. The game is an absolute money pit. You can't compete online unless you drop hundreds of dollars, and even then? Better have fun farming your badges for 2 weeks before those stats you just bought can mean anything. Oh, you have your badges / stats, but no boosters? Damn, that's another 10000 VC a week just to keep your character consistent. Oh man, you finally became consistent? How unfortunate! Now the game crashes at random times when you're having a good game, and you lose all those stats.

2k is a plague on the gaming community and it's about time we do something about it, otherwise they're going to keep shitting on us while simultaneously taking money from our wallets.

worst fucking game ever released.  21 years of this game series, and the AI has gotten progressively worse.  the cpu teammates act like negative iq chode mongrels that have never watched even half a millisecond of basketball in their life.  for example, rudy gobert was unable to stop a 5'11 point guard rookie from scoring a literal layup in the pain even with 2 other defenders in the paint.  absolutely no human being should be able to score under those conditions.  help defense is a complete dumpster fire of a feature.  i find that i have to defend literally ever single player that is even slighty open, since no person knows what help defense is.  instead of rotating a player off of ben simmons from the 3 point line, they decide to double team him.  FROM THE 3-POINT LINE. I SHOULDNT NEED TO EXPLAIN TO ANYONE THAT HAS EVEN WATCHED BASKETBALL THAT BENJAMIN SIMMONS CANNOT SHOOT A 3 TO SAVE HIS OWN LIFE IF WE GAVE HIM INFINITE ATTEMPTS.  when i call a pick-n-roll, i want the player to actually roll.  i know, i know, very shocking.  i call the PNR and they set a screen that barely brushes the molecules on the defenders jersey and just back off.  they make no attempt to drive to the basket.

now we get to the online portion.  i have played 3 total online games for myteam for one reason and one reason only.  latency.  unless you have NASA internet which can transfer data and 90 gigs a second, the 2k servers have more latency on a single button press than a 100 year old grandma that has alzheimers.

would rate -100/10 if i could.  they should pay people to play this game.

I have been playing 2k since Chris Paul was a rookie in New Orleans, so a long time. The franchise is doomed at this point, you guys don't listen to the community at all. I create my 2k account and start playing after I invest another 20 dollars into VC (pay-to-play) to get my character to a 75 and literally couldnt even find a match in the rec. Nothing. Me and my friend give up and figure maybe its too late and nobody is playing, the franchise is losing its community so I'm not too shocked. I get on a few days later and my account is wiped along with my character and the VC i put into the game. This is bullshit. I've never been so disgusted with a gaming franchise in my life. The game used to be so.. good. And the developers of this game refuse do anything about it. I want my money back and I want the money I spent on VC back. You should meet all or most of these criteria to buy this game: 
* It's on sale for at least 50% off
* You love basketball or have previously enjoyed 2K
* You're a PC only gamer or you have an ancient Xbox One, and don't want to buy a new console to play next gen (like me)
* You don't plan on buying this game solely for multiplayer purposes (the player base is nothing like console)

Otherwise, it is just not worth it. 2K is an incredibly greedy company that knows they're the only basketball game in town, and capitalize on their younger player base on pay to win bull****. The PC version is not well optimized, though it is playable, and I have to say, playing at 155hz instead of 60 is nice. But that is the only benefit of the PC version. For example, in MyCareer, when you're in a game on the bench you have to alt+tab several times for the "sim to next appearance" option to work. 

If it's on sale, and you know you'll play it casually, it's probably worth it. But I'm conflicted still on giving 2K any of my money.

TL;DR: Only buy this game if a. You have never played basketball or moved on earth or b. You need depression mixed with anger issues and high blood pressure.
This game is abysmal. Every issue 2k has ever had is all culminated into this one masterpiece of absolute awfulness. The AI acts like semi-smart actual basketball players while your Javale McGee will sit in the corner and refuse to move until he shoots 18 3's a game. The defense is unplayable and clunky and feels worse than any 2k i have ever played. The shooting is awful, so bad that you can miss an open shot from right under the basket. Nothing in this game feels good. MyTeam is awful because all the cards are overpriced so unless you actually dump money into the game, you spend hours grinding for one card then restart to get another card, just to get an OK starting core. All the actual human players in MyTeam abuse the same cheese and the game is just not remotely fun unless you can actually play with friends you know who aren't scumbags. MyCareer is an endless grind, and is utterly abysmal since unless you want to focus only on defense or only on scoring, you are a useless sack of meat on the court since all your teammates don't know how to play basketball. And on defense, you have to play defense 1v5 because the AI wants to permanently switch and also no matter what position you are, you will eventually be assigned to defend the point guard which is absolutely retarded when you try to make a paint beast like Shaq and expect him to lockdown Luka or Trae Young on the perimeter. Also, the game permanently makes you foul or fouls you so the gameplay feels incredibly choppy at every point and then on top of that, about 30% of the free throws you take have a broken camera where you can't see the player. I'm sure I missed other things in this game that have made me upset, but the moral of the story is this game has absolutely no upside and there is no reason to buy it unless you plan on playing with friends, because that is the only thing I have found even remotely enjoyable in this game. Please dear god 2k FIX YOUR DAMN GAME IT'S BEEN BROKEN FOR OVER 5 YEARS

Edit: On top of all this, now the AI won't even play the game correctly and the NBA players all act like baby colts learning how to walk on ice. They sprint past their personnel they're supposed to guard and then always leave the offense wide open. Shooting is abysmal still because the shot meter is invisible and apparently ratings and badges can't save anyone anymore. I don't think 2k devs have ever been outside and experienced physics, let alone played a second basketball in their lives. It's just honestly sad to see this portrayal of pro athletes. At least Madden, which has its issues, still feels like playing football. This just feels awful and sad and frustrating and honestly I don't think there is a single reason to purchase this game. Literally none. It's just 2k20 but even worse somehow, which I didn't know was possible. Honest to god, this game is, bar none, the worst video game I have ever played in my entire life and should never have been released.

Bought this game on sale. Installed all 88 gigabytes of it. Immediately upon booting the game it required YET ANOTHER UPDATE! Then tried to launch MyCareer and load in the face scan that I had made on the MyNBA2K21 app. Continuously it rejected my face scan no matter how many times that I re-scanned my face. Closed the app on my phone. Closed the game and relaunched it. Still did not work. I have no idea how 2K managed to break a feature that has worked in the past few years. Uninstalled... Requested Refund... Do better 2K...

Here I am once again. Every year, I tell myself "I will never fork over another dollar (or $60, in fact) to 2K for what is basically a roster update." But every year, I find myself purchasing this forbidden fruit and, unfortunately, this year was no exception.

To all those out there that hear that every year, 2K releases the same basketball game. This CANNOT be overstated. When the NBA2K developers pool their collective 4 brain cells to make the new game, I'm virtually certain that the only change they can pull out of their asses is something to the shot timing mechanic. Otherwise, you can expect a user interface with identical functionality, but with a different color scheme and design. That about sums up the changes every year. Oops, and a little roster update too. That's it! 2K is consistently charging us another $60 for the same game!

But wait, it's not over. As a cherry on top of this horse-shit sundae, 2K puts 0 effort into releasing a playable game. Plain and simple: the game is UNPLAYABLE. A year after the release of 2K20, I was still experiencing game-crashing bugs in the middle of matches on a regular basis. There is no reason why a game with this much funding, and this much notoriety, should be plagued with bugs for THIS LONG. These games have been produced since before I was born, yet they can't get rid of these experience-ruining bugs every year. And today, much to my dismay, as I opened the brand-spanking new NBA2K21 to play my first game, I immediately crash before I could even get to see Kyle Lowry's thick, juicy behind with 2K's "next-gen graphics."

You, the reader, may be asking: how can 2K be putting out shitty games every year but millions of people still buy them? Because. They. Can. Afford. To... 2K essentially has a monopoly on basketball games, meaning if someone wants a basketball game (which A LOT of people do), they HAVE to turn to 2K. Now, 2K has two options:

1. Go the benevolent route. Use the money into developing a game that isn't ridden with the aforementioned issues that make it downright unplayable at times. Or...

2. Put out doodoo butter and reap the profits because people will buy the game anyway.

Unfortunately, they went with the latter, and now we're here where we are today. 2K developers have shown no interest in giving us a good game. They mask the problems with the promise of "better graphics," but in reality it doesn't matter how good your graphics are if your users can't actually get into a game. I hope one of these days, some competitors show up in the basketball games scene to get them off their asses so that 2K can stay afloat and genuinely improve their game. Godspeed, 2K.

See you next year bitches.

update 2/9/2021:

mycareer is as garbage as last year. once your player starts putting up big numbers the AI instantly resorts to constant double-teaming and is not letting me play the game. my 74 overall point guard is constantly getting 20+ assists a game by just passing off of double teams.

mypark is a constant battle of snatch back upon snatch back until you get a desired animation into a shot that goes in if you get the timing right, regardless of your 3pt rating. defense is whack too, its basically pressing the steal button until you either foul or get the steal, which WILL happen even if your steal rating isnt high at all. its a far cry from the desired effect of having players specialize in 1 or 2 aspects, not to mention the lag issues and constant crashes in the pc version.

the only redeemable game mode in this game are the offline modes, which is what i play a lot of (play now, blacktop, myleague/mygm), but at full price, its not worth it. my initial review still stands (buy only if on sale), but also if you're only interested in the game for the online modes, then you're going to be extremely disappointed.

I spent all day researching this title. I even tried youtube videos to help me understand all the bad reviews.  I love hooping and just needed a distraction that could remind me of playing ball.  Eventually i figured i spent more than the cost of this game in personal time researching it so i took a shot (at sale price), guessing i could always get a refund.  There was absolutely nothing wrong with this game.  It plays great on my system, and because i don't have any other 2k titles to compare it to (exept something from xbox 360 in 2008) it looked and played perfect.  Defense sucks, but its the same in the modern nba so thats realistic.  This was definitely worth it.  I don't have a gaming pc but its pretty up to date for work so it doesn't have a problem with this game.   Also i hate dealing with modders and toxic online communities so no need for me to play online.  Hope this helps some people who just want to pass time avoid missing out on a solid title.

[h1] Terribly Optimized [/h1]
Bought this game since I have NBA 2k16, and wanted an updated experience. Saw that it was on sale, and read lots and lots of negative comments. I played it on my buddy's ps5, and thought it looked half decent besides micro-transactions so I got it. 

This game is TERRIBLY optimized for pc. Sure, it runs great on console, but pc is whole different story. When booting up it was set to 720 fps, and that's a no-go for me. I went to the settings and set everything to how I thought would be decent. (Medium to everything basically, low crowd, media, and hair, with 2x anti aliasing and at 1080p. I thought it should be able to push around 60 fps smoothly at least at those settings, since I have an i7 10th gen and a 2070 with 16 GB of RAM. 

That was not the case. The game ran at around 20 FPS in the menu, and ran the same in game. 2k16 ran at easily 80 FPS with high setting on everything, which granted its an older game so it's easier to run. I then set all the settings to the absolute lowest settings. Ran at 26 FPS. Very poor overall when I have a laptop that's able to run any modern game other than this at 60 FPS with high-ultra settings. 

Also, using up a controller with this game? Cheeks. It has "B" set to the advance button in the menus? This isn't a ps2 game. Everyone uses "A" to advance through stuff. Also using "X" to go back in the menus is very funky. You have to go through every setting of controller support to get it to work right, and nothing is automatically bound for a Xbox controller. Makes no sense to me at all. 

After spending so much time tweaking with settings to get the game to maybe run decent with no good result and 26 minutes of game play, I can thoroughly say that this game is terrible. No matter if it was on sale for 20 bucks, not worth it at all to me. Maybe if they fix how the game runs on pc I would be interested again.

Thought I'd try out this game since its on sale and here's my experience.

Shooting - Its kinda cool they tried to bring back shot aiming but its so heavily inaccurate and hard to align to where even the simplest of layups and wide open shots miss so frequently. You're better off playing with the shot meter off.

Movement - I feel like I get stuck when I move and my character act like he can't stop once he starts running. Also body blocking is a huge issue when it comes to defense as your teammates more often than not hold you back if you're a perimeter defender. Especially in my career. You have to change your whole route if you don't want to get stuck between 2 players.

Aesthetics - Its an upgrade but not that huge of a leap. The main upgrade is the detail in the facial hair. And it wouldn't be a 2k game if the facescans weren't bad cause oh boy I still can't get mine to look right.

My Career - One of the most unfun experiences I've played from a 60 overall. You cannot score unless its off of a fast break and you are unable to access neighborhood until you complete all the college games. If you skip midway through then you of course lose that salary but its probably worth it as its not much of a difference being 500 if you skip and 600 if you don't skip. Compared to 2k20's my career, you at least get 750 - 1000 on your first character.

I think the best way to do this is a pro and con list:

Pros
- Hard foul animations are actually pretty good
- Transition fouls are more realistic to the nba game, they're hard and prevent the layup and are pretty common in a 1 v 1 fastbreak
- Players under the rim are fairly contested, in previous 2ks they could kind of just shoot layups with a lean and it would seem uncontested, this makes offence rebounds and put-backs more realistic

Cons
- Transition defence is completely broken. If you miss a shot, there's a very good chance they can just throw a full court pass for an open layup. This happened to me literally up to half of my missed shots being uncontested fast breaks. Even if you do have a defender back, the controls are so clunky that if you're not perfectly placed (which is luck because where they start is based on the computer) you can't even contest players, let alone stop them.

-Play calling: Often you will call a play and it simply just won't happen. The player will set a screen nowhere near your man, or just not at all. Half the time they do set an off ball screen (so CPU controlled) it's an illegal screen, which you can do nothing about. For some reason they added an extra button to call plays which is just bad for quality of life, such as late shot clock situations, wanting a screen from a specific player etc.

- Defence is incredibly clunky and players are very slow to change direction. When quick player gets by (which obviously happens irl so that's not an issue in itself) there is no help defence at all or two defenders will come and it's just an easy bucket. On screens the CPU will often make a dumb play, like double a non 3 point shooter, switch into a terrible mismatch, or just let the roller have an open layup and just stand still.

- Offence Star players struggle to deal with minimal pressure at the rim if they're not locked in to one of the favourable animations. Players like Shaq struggle to finish over defenders like Iverson for example. Over a foot and 100 lbs difference and one foot from the rim it's a 50/50. Spacing is terrible. Eg. If you call for a screen on the left wing and theres someone in the left corner, they will rise to the FT line extended and then not set a screen. So you have the ball handler, the screener, and just a random dude all within a couple of feet of each other.

-Servers - Still broken. Playable, but expect 2 second freezes up to 5 times a minute. Disconnects also once in a while.

Finally - why is this not the next gen version on PC? PC has much higher capacity for graphics than a console, so there is no reason why 2k should not have released the next gen version here. The gameplay and this lead me to the conclusion that 2k simply will not make fundamentally sound changes to their game, even if they are essential for a good basketball game until people stop buying it. I hope that there is some competition from other companies in the future.

I don't know what possessed the developers making this game but it is constantly interrupted by unskippable garbage to the point that it just becomes frustrating to play. Every time a timeout is called in game you're forced to watch a 5-10 second generic roll of the players walking off the court, followed by the timeout clock accompanied by one of five or six generic scenes they have to play during the break. You can't skip the timeout until five seconds of its actual clock have elapsed. This might not sound like much but like the NBA, each team has six timeouts so up to twelve times a game your gameplay is interrupted for 15 seconds for no reason other than what? To make the game more immersive? Just give me the option to skip or better yet skip by default. 

The port is also buggy. It starts up in windowed mode about 25% of the time, sometimes it decides to ignore controller inputs when selecting which game to play next and a bunch of other minor but cumulatively annoying issues. It's got fun core gameplay but everything that's packaged in is just not worth it.

I love 2K, they are always my favorite sports game and I can always sink hours into them. However, the matching systems are horrible for MyCareer, you will never get into a Rec game without a full squad. Also the game can just be buggy when it comes to squading up with friends in general. Ive had to restart the game multiple times when trying to squad up with friends because the server will just randomly disconnect and put you in limbo.

It's a good game all things considered, the grind isnt really all that bad, if you really cheese the your mycareer you wont ever need to buy VC to get a maxed out player in around ~50 hours. Also maxing out other builds will be way fast after youve finished your first season with your main build. 

Buy the game when its 50% off or more. It's not worth anywhere near over $30.

We all know this game is money hungry. We all know it's the same game as last year. We all know about the constant online cheaters. So what if you're just trying to play single player, or MyTeam single player modes? Well I'm here to tell you, 2k has reached an all time LOW with ALL OF THE BUGGY ANIMATIONS. I've played this game for 3 hours straight and have ran into more animation bugs and weird nonsense than my entire time playing 2k20 and even 2k19 for that matter. The positives are, yes its a 2k game so they do have player specific animations and tendencies and roster updates, which is awesome. However I remember always playing 2k games and just simply enjoying the game. Playing a basketball game that looks realistic as if it was an actual broadcast. Well that's just not possible in 2k21 because the immersion gets ruined by speedy, glitchy, stupid animation bugs. I hate to do nothing but complain because this is the best basketball sim on the market in my opinion, and I LOVE basketball. It's just very frustrating when a game like 2k has SO much potential to be GREAT but money is money right?

I feel rather mixed about this game, as I do with most of the modern sports titles. I do have a blast playing it. It's fun, as basketball is fun, and it is even better when I play with my friends. When I play with my friends, on MyCareer or just online games against them, I would never want to replace that, despite the criticisms. But, there are just so many I have on top of the fun that keeps me from recommending the game.

For one, this is not the next gen graphics. This is the 2K that is left behind in terms of the console upgrades. There are the usual complaints of greed among 2K that I feel like I have to harp on. Everything from leveling up your MyPlayer to buying packs in MyTeam requires VC, and quite a lot of it. To me, it is just a greedy practice to charge so much for a game to also have so many roadblocks that can be hurtled with extra cash. The game feels unrealistic in so many places, and rarely gets updates to fix it. So many player's tendency's in game are wrong. There are Center's in the game that have never taken 3's in their whole career's taking 1 a game here. Some people's shot tendency is too high, others too low, and far more problems than I could realistically list here.

The man reason I really cannot recommend this to you is that half of the reason to buy NBA 2K on PC is the modding community. While there are some modders working to produce amazing content for this game, a lot of them have left this one behind, or stayed behind in 2K20, because of how this console is last gen. The main reason I bough 2K20 was for the mods. Roster updates, classic teams, graphical enhancements and more. The modders out there work diligently to make for 2K's shortcomings in this game, and the base here is just lacking compared to last year.

Honestly, if you're looking to buy one of these basketball games, please just go buy 2K20 when it goes on sale. You can update the roster, and enjoy yourself with so many amazing mods to enhance your experience. As for this game, I just can't bring myself to recommend it. 5/10

This game is complete ass outside of mods which didn't even work for me. You will be playing the PS4/XB1 version too. Refunded after the first day. Will not be purchasing an NBA2K game until it is clear that 2K cares enough about the PC community, or rather the community as a whole, to stop making a virtual casino with basketball DLC.

I've been playing the 2K series since 2k12. It just keeps on getting worse year by year.
People play 2k because, well, they've monopolize the basketball game. I mean, what other options do you have if you want to play a realistic-ish basketball game? NBA Live is no more, and there is pretty much no other game left.

Pros:
1. The MyLeague is a rather enjoyable mode. If you like sims, its a pretty fun sim game.
2. Very decent graphics, for shoes. Every year, they advertise how realistic the shoes are for this game. And yeah, they are pretty damn great looking.
3. The LiveOps of MyTeam is actually pretty decent.


Cons:
1. 2K can make ultra realistic looking shoes. But the models in MyPlayer is just flat out trash. Most of the props in MyPlayer mode are made up of low polygons with badly made textures. I've made way better models in my university class. Oh, and I'm sure a lot of the prop models haven't been updated since like 2k15.
2. The internet connection is just flat out trash. In this day and age where online games is a norm, 2K still manage to provide an online game with an input lag of at least 1~2 second. Oh, and, it's been like this since when the MyPark first release, a couple years ago, with no improvements.
3. AI. For people who complaints about the AI in syberpunk, well, they haven't player 2k21 yet.
4. Bugs. You think syberpunk is buggy and glitchy and unplayable? Try 2k21.
5. Features like MyPlayer and MyTeam is a bloody grind. If you are a casual player who won't pay for microtransactions, well, you won't enjoy it as much as those who's willing to pay.

A lot of the issues that people have with the game, like horrible prop models, horrible AI, ridiculous connection, grind or pay extra, and so so so much more, are not just 2k21 specific. Players have been complaining about these issues for years. And apparently, if you've monopolize the market, these issues are of no concern.

Conclusion:
You are gonna hate it, say it's trash, and write a negative review on it. But at the end of the day, you're likely still going to play it, because, what other option do you have for a NBA basketball game?

Pros: 
- Gameplay can be fun, i mean its basically the same game since forever and basketball was popular before this game came along so no real points there.
- Limted mode is a good idea and stops the 5 out, curry sliding cheesers from dominating.
- Unlimited mode is fun..... if you can connect.

Cons:
Bugs:  omfg there are so so many bugs and for a game that costs $80 AND requires more $$$ to play it's a DISGRACE. They literally brake the game with every update.
Losing your XP progress, not getting correct challenges ticked off and
the most recent one is the game freezing on 70% loading ... then you take a loss, lose contracts and shoes...smh.

Servers: again omfg. The servers are TERRIBLE and that's if you can even get a match and the game doesn't crash?

Player base:  Its very very small, and in additon becuase of the cheaters even less play online unless they have to for their "grind" xp.

Cheaters : There are so many cheaters that use a script to crash the game when they are losing making you lose your win, progress and items you used , crash games on loading, using modded controllers, you name it. 

If you;re someone who cheats seriously GO f*** yourself.

The way 2k treats its player base is something to behold, in a bad way.

Overall i still play the game because i like basketball, if a serious contender came along at double the price and looked after its customers Id happily never play this game again.
